Seven years ago, with a lot of effort, she started a business that sells stationary and various items, which is located in the La Ceja municipality. 

Due to the fact that her customer base is growing and they are demanding more and more products each day, Amparo is requesting a loan to buy an assortment of stationary to offer her customers a greater variety of products in her business. 

With this loan, Amparo’s business will have a lot of momentum, since her inventory and sales will improve.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of stationary.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 23 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, posee una  tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, la joven vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This young woman, age 23, has her face pixelated because she lives in a high-risk area. She manages a store in her place of residence. She has many customers because of the good prices. The borrower lives in her own home along with her husband and their two children.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, snack foods, sweet bread, and other items so that she can earn more income and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, snack foods, sweet bread, and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fish for resale in the local market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase new models of cell phones to resell to his customers.

loans.name: 05 Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hoa has a manufacturing business making cleaning brushes. Hoa has been involved in this business for five years. She is requesting a loan to purchase more materials to make cleaning brushes to sell.

Hoa is 53 years old and she is married with two children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province. Hoa is the group leader of the 05 Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of three members. 

This is Hoa's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hoa hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase more materials to make cleaning brushes to sell.

loans.name: 12- Thành Lập - Ngư Lộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhung operates a food stall / restaurant selling fish. Nhung has been involved in this business for three years. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish to resell.

Nhung is 25 years old and is married with two children. She is the group leader of the 12-Thành Lập - Ngư Lộc solidarity group, which consists of six members. 

This is Nhung's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. The main harship that Nhung faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Nhung hopes to buy a motorbike, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell.

loans.name: Diego Alexander

texts.es:
Diego es un joven campesino de 25 años de edad, trabajador y humilde, que desde niño aprendió a realizar todas las labores del campo, gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres. 
Esto le ha permitido progresar y, hoy en día posee cultivos de zanahoria y papa, cultivos que atiende todos los días y las cosechas son vendidas en la plaza de mercado del municipio de Dabeiba, adicionalmente, realiza labores de jornalero en diferentes fincas de la región, pues con ello complementa los ingresos con los que vela por el bienestar de su esposa y su hija. 
Con el apoyo del crédito solicitado en la Corporación Interactuar, comprará materiales como alambre y madera para la construcción de un sistema de riego, con esto seguirá cuidando sus cultivos y tendrá una mejor cosecha, más productiva y así mejorará los ingresos a la hora de vender sus productos.
Diego, con su espíritu emprendedor, su pujanza y tenacidad, quiere seguir luchando para cumplir el sueño de tener una finca propia, en la que pueda cultivar mucha más variedad de productos y así mejorar la rentabilidad del negocio, garantizando una estabilidad económica para su familia.
texts.en:
Diego is a young farmer who is 25 years old. He is hardworking and humble. When he was a child, he learned to complete all of the jobs of the land, thanks to his parents’ teachings.

This has allowed him to progress, and today he has carrot and potato crops. He takes care of his crops every day and he sells the harvested crops in the marketplace in the Dabeiba municipality. Additionally, he is a day laborer for different farms in the region. With this, he compliments his income, which he uses to look out for the wellbeing of his wife and daughter. 

With the support of the requested loan from Interactuar, he will buy materials such as wire and wood in order to construct an irrigation system. With this he will continue taking care of his crops and he will have a better and more productive harvest. This will allow him to improve his income when he sells his products.

Diego, with his entrepreneurial spirit, his strength, and his determination, wants to keep fighting to reach his dream of having his own farm, in which he can grow a greater variety of products. This would let him improve his business’s profitability, guaranteeing economic stability for his family.

loans.use: to buy materials such as wire and wood to construct an irrigation system.

loans.name: Amparo

texts.en:
Amparo is 64 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Amparo runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft-drinks, noodles, detergent soap, shampoo, diapers, eggs, etc.

She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell. Amparo would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell, like canned goods, soft-drinks, noodles, detergent soap, shampoo, diapers, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Thuy's Group

texts.en:
Thuy was born in 1986, and is a Kinh ethnic majority woman. She currently lives with her husband and her lovely son in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from raising pigs, and they sell about two tons of pig meat every year. The revenue is between VND 75 million and 80 million, but it is not much after deducting all costs. So, she has to consider her spending very carefully and save in order to have enough for covering the family’s living expenses. She has saved a little amount, but it is not enough to invest and to pay for her son’s education fees. Therefore, she really wants to borrow a loan to pay for her son’s education fees.

She expects the loan will help her son to have better learning conditions, and she will work hard to get money to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: to pay for her son’s education fees.

loans.name: Paula Rosario

texts.es: Paula de 43 años de edad se dedica desde hace 10 años a la venta de tamales, vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y su hijo, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda encementando el piso y cambiando las puertas pero con lo que ganan de sus ventas no le alcanza, por esa razón solicitan nuevamente un credito para la compra de cemento, arena, puertas y pago de mano de obra para que ella y su familia vivan cómodos y seguros.
texts.en:
Paula is 43 years old and lives in her own home with her life partner and their son. She has been making a living selling tamales for the last 10 years. 

She wants to make improvements to her home by installing a concrete floor and changing the doors. However, she cannot afford to do so with what she makes from her sales. For this reason, she is once again requesting a loan to buy cement, sand, and doors; and to pay for labor. This way she and her family will live in comfort and safety.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and doors; and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is now 48 years old. He used his previous loan amount to purchase a motorcycle for his transportation business. It was profitable and he was able to repay the loan successfully. He is also a tea farmer and it has been profitable. His current monthly income is KES 28,000.

He plans to use this loan to pay school fees for his child who is in high school. He will use the anticipated profits from his business to pay the school fees for his children and ensure they are well educated. 

This is his sixth loan term from VisionFund Kenya and he has repaid his previous loans successfully. In the future he hopes to grow his business, be successful, and educate his children.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his child who is in high school.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is 54 years old, married and together with her spouse, has been blessed with six children. She buys green tea leaves from tea farmers and sells to various tea processing companies. She also sells milk. She has been in this business for four years and it has been profitable. 

She plans to use this loan to pay school fees for her child. She will also use the anticipated profits from her business to pay school fees for her children and ensure they are all well-educated.

This is her second loan from VisionFund Kenya and she paid her previous loan successfully. In the future, she hopes to grow her business and be successful in life.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her child.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
For the last eight years, Simon has been in a rental business and earns a monthly income of KES 56,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). He is married to Jane and blessed with three children who are now all adults.

He has applied for his 10th loan of 100,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the loan to buy more materials for building more rental houses.

Simon will use the anticipated profits to provide for the family's basic needs. He hopes to grow his business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more materials for building more rental houses.

loans.name: Luyen's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Luyen, born in 1973, is a Thai ethnic woman. She has been joining in the program of M7-MFI since 2009 (before that the M7-MFI was a social fund). She was one of the first members to join in the program. She currently lives with her husband, her son and her daughter-in-law in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from cultivation and breeding, and the income is just enough to cover the family’s living expenses and save a little amount left. She is intending to breed cows for reproduction and goats for milk but the amount she has saved is not enough. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan to breed cows.

She expects the loan will help her family effectively invest in breeding to get a high yield, and her family will have better living conditions. She will be working hard to get money to repay the loan with M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: breed cows.

loans.name: 11 Phú Xuân Hưng Lộc Group

texts.en:
Viện is 64 years old and is married with four children.  She operates a food stall / restaurant selling fish and has been involved in this business for three years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

Viện is the group leader of the 11 Phú Xuân Hưng Lộc solidarity group, which consists of three members. This is Viện's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish to resell.

With her business profit, Viện hopes for her children to find a good job, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell.

loans.name: Emilly

texts.en: Emilly is 24 years old. She is married and together they are blessed with children whose ages range from five to 21 years respectively. Emilly provides salon services to her clients, a business she has done this for the last two years, earning a monthly income of KES 48,000. She has requested her first loan with VisionFund Kenya of KES 30,000 that she will use to add stock of hair products such as relaxers, shampoo, hair oils and conditioners as well as hair extensions of different kinds. With the anticipated profits, Emilly will be able to repay her loan as well as plough income back into the business. Her hopes and dreams for the future is to educate her children.

loans.use: to add stock of hair products for her beauty salon business.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is a 48-year-old woman married to John who adds additional income to support his family. They have been blessed with five children.  Rachel has been operating a fruits and vegetables business for five years earning herself an income of KES 10,000 at the end of every month. She was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a credit officer and is now servicing her first loan of KES 20,000 and intends to buy tomatoes, potatoes and onions to sell to her customers on a daily basis.

Rachel plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees to her children and hopes to become a successful business woman with a bright future.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, potatoes and onions to sell to her customers on a daily basis.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 40 years. She is married and together with her spouse they support six people.

Eunice sells shoes, a business she has done for the last 16 years, earning a monthly income of Kshs. 30,000.

Eunice has requested her first loan with VisionFund Kenya of Kshs. 20,000 which she will use to add additional stock of new shoes.

With the anticipated profits, Eunice will be able to repay her loan as well as plough back into the business.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to be wealthy and to be happy.

loans.use: to add additional stock of shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel sells livestock in Kapsabet town and has been in this business for the past four years. He is 24 years old and single with no children. He supports four members of his family.

He has requested a loan from VisionFund Kenya and he will use it to buy more livestock to sell. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business. 

This is his fourth loan term from VisionFund Kenya and he paid his previous loans successfully. His future hopes and dreams are to improve his living standards, eradicate poverty and live a better life.

loans.use: To buy more livestock to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for a sewing machine.

loans.name: Haia

texts.en: Haia is a 22-year-old single lady who lives with her family in Jarash.  She is now in her second year of college to get a diploma majoring in Accounting. Her father is retired from the army because of a health deficit, and his pension is not enough to meet all of the fees and expenses of the house. Haia is therefore requesting a loan to cover the rest of her semester fees.

loans.use: To cover the rest of her semester fees

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sara is a 22-year-old single woman who lives in Al Baqa'a. She is now in her last year in University. Sarah is one of four members in her family, and her parents are unemployed. Her brother is the sole breadwinner of the family. The increasing high cost of living makes it difficult to complete her education because they cannot pay university fees.

Sarah has a lot of dreams that make her determined to complete her studies. That led Sarah to apply for an educational loan to help her cover the semester fees, which will make her future more successful.

loans.use: To pay for her semester fees.

loans.name: Kpangmanga - Nyong Nayili Group

texts.en:
Ashetu is a 45-year-old hardworking woman from Nyong Nayili in the Northern region of Ghana. Ashetu is married and has five children. Ashetu is the individual pictured sitting on the chair with a sample of packaged shea butter meant for the export market.

Ashetu is a member of a shea butter processing group that has been in business for the last 10 years. The name of the group is Kpangmanga - Nyong Nayili. She earns a good profit from the business. The group has benefited from several capacities building in the area of their business through the efforts of Grameen Ghana on how to process high-quality shea butter product for the local and international markets.

Ashetu and Kpangmanga - Nyong Nayili group have asked for a loan of GHS 9,500. Ashetu’s share of the loan is GHS 500, which would be used to buy shea nuts for processing. Ashetu aspires to produce in large quantities within a well designed and constructed Processing Centre in five years time, earn more income, as well as repay this loan and support her family with good healthcare and education.

Ashetu thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy shea nuts for processing.

loans.name: 11 Minh Đức Minh Lộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Liên operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish, and has been involved in this business for two years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish to resell.

Liên is 25 years old and is married with two children. She is the group leader of the 11 Minh Đức Minh Lộc solidarity group, which consists of six members. This is Liên's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

With her business profit, Liên hopes to build a new house, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell.

loans.name: Nhóm 39 Minh Thắng, Minh Lộc Group

texts.en:
Duyên is 28 years old and is married with two children. She operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish, and has been involved in this business for five years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

Duyên is the group leader of the Nhóm 39 Minh Thắng, Minh Lộc solidarity group, which consists of five members. In 2012, Duyên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women, and is now requesting a loan to purchase fish to resell.

In the future, Duyên hopes for her business to do well, to remodel her house, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell.

loans.name: Chinh's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chinh, born in 1983, is a Thai ethnic woman. Her family consists of four members, including her husband, her two daughters and her. Her family lives in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from her husband's monthly salary, so she has to spend carefully in order to have enough money to cover the family’s living expenses and save a little amount left. But, that amount is not enough to buy fertilizer for the coming coffee crop next year, so she wants to borrow a loan to buy fertilizer for her coffee field.

She hopes the loan amount will help her family cultivate the coffee field well and the next crop will bring her family coffee trees laden with fruit. And for herself, she will work hard to get money to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her coffee field.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To venture into other areas of farming.

loans.name: Gorret

texts.en: Gorret lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with four children (two go to school). She also takes care of additional family members. She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major expenses include food and school fees. Gorret operates a canteen at the market on a retail basis. She works six days a week and serves all kinds of people. She has been in this business for the last 11 years. Her major challenges include transportation and seasonality. Gorret has requested a loan of 1,800,000 Ugandan shillings MCDT SACCO to buy boxes of sweets, biscuits, soap, sugar, soda and cooking oil. She hopes to expand her canteen into a retail shop and buy a refrigerator.

loans.use: To buy boxes of sweets, biscuits, soap, sugar, soda and cooking oil

loans.name: Philip

texts.en: Philip is married and the father of four children. He lives in Molo, a remote rural town that has harsh living conditions and requires tough skin to survive. He has earned a living by farming for the last seven years and his main income sources are milk, eggs, and various crops produced on his farm. He is requesting a loan to buy a dairy cow. Dairy farming is one of the most profitable and promising business ventures in Kenya because returns are available to the farmer within a short period of time. That is why Juhudi Kilimo is financing small farmers with assets like this so that they can generate income and guarantee payments. Today, very few other businesses can guarantee these quick returns of cash. The additional income from dairy farming will be used in securing the future of his school-going children, because he believes that education is the gateway to success. Increased profits will also be used in improving his living conditions and in trying to get out of the poverty bracket.

loans.use: To buy a quality dairy cow

loans.name: Flavia

texts.en: Flavia lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children and goes to school. She has no additional family members. She sells chips and sausages at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last four years. She works six days a week. She has requested a loan of UGX 200,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy a bag of Irish potatoes, cooking oil, and spices. Her major challenge is the taxes that increase all the time. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major expenses include food and school fees. She would like to buy serving dishes to serve her customers better.

loans.use: To buy a bag of Irish potatoes, cooking oil, and spices.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy the fast-moving items in her genge (grocery store)

loans.name: Julian

texts.es:
Julian es un hombre de 50 años de edad, casado, tiene 1 hijo varón de 14 años, y su negocio es una tienda de barrio.
Él es emprendedor, buen padre, trabajador, constante y muy responsable. Su negocio lo desarrolla en un mercado muy conocido en la zona oeste de la ciudad, de clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 8-18 grados centígrados.
Julian es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con sus 3 hijos que ya son independientes, viven en una casa alquilada que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su actividad principal es una tienda de barrio con alimentos de primera necesidad como; pan, azúcar, arroz, fideo, refrescos, etc. “al frente de mi negocio se está construyendo un hospital, en el futuro mi negocio será más rentable…” comenta. La oportunidad de comprar un terreno para construir su casa se hizo presente, y él no quiere perder la oportunidad de tener su casa propia. Su sueño es tener un mini-mercado. El desea realizar la compra de un lote de terreno para construir su casa y dejar de pagar alquiler. 
Es por esos motivos que Julian solicita un préstamo para la compra de un lote de terreno para construir su casa y dejar de pagar alquiler.
texts.en: Julian is 50 years old. He is married and has a 14-year-old son. His business is a neighborhood store. He is enterprising, a good father, hard-working, steadfast, and very responsible. He operates his business in a well-known market in the west part of the city. The climate is cold and dry, with a temperature that varies during the day between 8 - 18 degrees centigrade. Julian has brown skin and short black hair, and is short in stature. His native language is Aymara, but he speaks Spanish in the general culture and for his business. He shares his life with his 3 children who are now independent. They live in a rented house that has running water, electricity and sewage services. His main business is a neighborhood store that sells basic necessities such as bread, sugar, rice, beans, soft drinks, etc. "Across from my business they are building a hospital, so in future my business will be more profitable", he says. An opportunity has arisen for him to buy a piece of land to build himself a house, and he does not want to miss the chance to own his own house. His dream is to have a mini-market. He would like to buy the piece of land to build his house and stop paying rent. It is for this reason that he is requesting a loan, to buy a lot on which to build his house and stop paying rent.

loans.use: to buy a lot on which to build his house and stop paying rent.

loans.name: Giang

texts.en:
Giang, 34, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City.

Giang has been running a food stall in front of her house, selling Hue noodles for three years. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying better-quality food to sell, such as beef, noodles and ingredients to make food to sell to satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business will run smoothly and will generate a higher income, to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy beef, noodles and ingredients to make food to sell

loans.name: Hui

texts.en:
Hui is 57 years old and married with two children. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. She has been running a business selling clothes and fruit.

She started her business two years ago. She intends to take a loan to gradually expand her business by buying a variety of different clothes to sell to her customers. 

She hopes her business will run smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a variety of different clothes to sell to her customers

loans.name: Quyen

texts.en: Quyen is requesting a new loan to buy good-quality food and many kinds of soft drinks to stock her stall. This purchase will help her to better attract and satisfy her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her food stall and increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy good-quality food and many kinds of soft drinks to stock her stall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase construction supplies to expand his house.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong, 49, is married and has two children; one son and daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn an income running a business manufacturing brass tubes. 

They started this business ten years ago. Phuong is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more brass in bulk to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy more brass in bulk to manufacture brass tubing to sell

loans.name: Ayat

texts.en: Ayat is a 20-year-old single lady living in Jerash. She is a third-year student in university, majoring in Applied English. She is the big sister of six brothers, so her parents face some financial difficulties which led Ayat to apply for an educational loan to help her cover the semester fees. Ayat`s future plan is to find good work so she can help her brothers to complete their studies.

loans.use: to pay for her semester fees

loans.name: Anabel

texts.en:
Anabel works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Anabel has been in this business for 4 years now.

Anabel has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Anabel would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: John James

texts.es:
John es un campesino, humilde y trabajador con el empuje y verraquera que distingue a los hombres y mujeres del campo.
Es un Hombre de mente emprendedora y desde muy pequeño aprendió todos los oficios del campo como cultivos y crianza de animales, tanto así que hoy en día tiene su propio cultivo de frutas; alimentos que vende en la plaza de mercado del municipio de Dabeiba.
Este personaje tiene como propósito aumentar sus cultivos y mejorar los que actualmente tiene y es por eso que acude a la ayuda de un crédito con la Corporación Interactuar para la compra de insumos agropecuarios como fertilizantes, abonos y la compra de semillas.
El préstamo le dará la oportunidad de progresar como empresario y como persona, además de aumentar sus ingresos y seguir aportando el sustento en su hogar.
Él lo único que quiere es poder mejorar la calidad de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en: John is a humble, hard-working farmer with the drive that distinguishes country men and women. He is a man with an entrepreneurial mind. When he was very young he learned country activities such as growing crops and raising animals, and he now has his own fruit crops that he sells in the municipal market of Dabeiba. He would like to expand his crops and improve the ones that he already has, so he is requesting a loan through the Interactuar corporation to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizer, manure, and seeds. The loan will give him an opportunity to grow as a businessman and as a person, and also to increase his income and continue providing for his household. The only thing that he wants is to be able to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizer, manure, and seeds.

loans.name: Waridi Group

texts.en:
Ziada is in her late 50s and is single with four grown-up children.  She has been running several projects by selling charcoal, local chicken and fabrics for seven years now.  She works from 10am to 7pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Ziada's 14th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to begin selling charcoal, local chicken and the fabrics.  She has managed to pay back all of her loans successfully.  She used the profit to take care of herself and to pay back the loan dues.  She will use this loan to buy sacks of charcoal and to increase her fabrics stock.  She dreams of building another house.

Ziada will share this loan with her loan group "Waridi", which consist of seven members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal and to increase stock of fabric.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.es:
La socia Ofelia  se sigue dedicando al negocio de bazar, la socia vende regalos y adornos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y el va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de bazar. La socia solicita el  credito para comprar adornos y peluches.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member Ofelia continues earning a living through a festive goods business. She sells gifts and decorations and works from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m. She has many years of experience in this business, which is going very well.

Her dream is to grow the business of selling festive items. She's seeking the loan to buy decorations and stuffed animals.

The member is happy for the loan and promises to comply with the payments of her quota.

loans.use: to buy decorations and stuffed animals.

loans.name: Quyen

texts.en:
Quyen is 51 years old and married with two children. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn income by running a food stall selling noodles with meat. 

She started her business thirteen years ago. She intends to get a loan to gradually expand her business by buying good-quality food to sell to her customers. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy good-quality food to sell to her customers

loans.name: Evila Del Carmen

texts.es: Evila de 56 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo y su nieto, ella se dedica desde hace 10 años a la agricultura su principal siembra es el maíz, también se dedica a la crianza de ganado, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía y asi poder continuar con su trabajo y tener una mejo calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Evila is 56 years old and resides in her own home along with her son and grandson. She has been farming for 10 years and her main crop is corn. Evila also raises livestock.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest controls, and also pay for improvements to the land that is shown in the photograph. As a result, she can continue with her work and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest controls, and also pay for improvements to her land.

loans.name: Tam

texts.en:
Tam is 52 years old and married with three children. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. She earns income by running a food stall to sell soft drinks.

She started her business two years ago. She intends to get a loan to gradually expand her business by buying a larger quantity and variety of soft drinks to sell to her customers. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a larger quantity and variety of soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
Angel tiene 25 años de edad, vive junto a su cónyuge y sus dos menores hijos en casa propia de material rústico en el distrito de Santo Tomás, ubicado en la provincia de Cutervo, de la región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte del Perú. Su población se dedica principalmente al cultivo de frutales, café, caña de azúcar, maíz y hortalizas.

El se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de café de la variedad catimore desde hace 3 años, en su parcela también tiene sembrado frutas como lúcuma y plátano. Cuenta con experiencia en el sector y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. Ha solicitado un préstamo para dar un control fitosanitario a su cultivo con la compra de plaguicidas, así como para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para el mantenimiento de este. Con esto Angel espera mejorar su producción y ofrecer un mejor café a sus clientes, lo que le permitirá incrementar su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Angel is 25 years old and lives together with his spouse and their two minor children in their own house. It's made of rustic material and located in the Santo Tomás district, Cutervo province in the Cajamarca region in the northern Sierra of Peru. Its population makes a living mainly by growing fruits, coffee, sugar cane, corn and vegetables.

For three years, he's earned a living through agriculture, especially growing the catimore variety of coffee. In his parcel, he also grows fruits like eggfruit (a greeb fruit native to the Andes) and bananas. He has experience in the industry and very good personal and work references in the area. 

He's asked for a loan to do a plant health check with his crops by buying pesticides, as well as compost and fertilizers to maintain them. With this, Angel hopes to improve his production and offer his customers better coffee. This will allow him to increase his income level and therefore improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to give his plants a health check by purchasing pesticides, as well as to buy compost and fertilizers.

loans.name: Phung

texts.en:
Phung is 54 years old and married with four children. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn income by running a food stall to sell noodles with meat. 

She started her business thirteen years ago. She intends to get a loan to gradually expand her business by buying good-quality food to sell to her customers. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy good-quality food to sell to her customers

loans.name: Oscar Noe

texts.es:
Oscar de 20 años de edad estudió hasta 9° grado de educación básica, es soltero y no tiene hijos, abandonó sus estudios y se dedicó a trabajar para poyar a sus padres y hacerse de sus cosas; vive aun con ellos y tres hermanos más.

Oscar es agricultor de granos básicos, trabaja con sus padre y sus hermanos, pero también presta servicio militar, decidió tomar este empleo al no tener otra forma de tener ingresos estables, para llegar al destacamento viaja en autobús 40 kilómetros. Solicita el préstamo para comprar 20 bolsas de cemento, arena, 300 bloques, hierro y demás para construir su vivienda. Sueña con una vez terminada su vivienda formar una familia.
texts.en: Oscar is 20 years old and went to school as far as the 9th grade. He is single and has no children. He stopped going to school and began working in order to support his parents. He still lives with them, along with his three siblings. Oscar grows basic grains, working with his parents and siblings. However, he also serves in the military. This is a job that he took because he had no other means of earning a stable income. He travels 40 kilometers by bus to get to the military detachment. He is requesting a loan to buy 20 bags of cement, sand, 300 blocks, iron, and other things to build his house. His dream is to be able to start a family once he has finished his house.

loans.use: to buy 20 bags of cement, sand, 300 blocks, iron, and other things.

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es:
Marcelino, de 70 años de edad, estudió hasta segundo grado, está casado desde hace más de 40 años, tiene 2 hijos, pero ya están casados.

Marcelino, se dedicaba a la agricultura, pero ahora es comerciante.- Actualmente, tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa desde hace más de 20 años, opto por dejar la agricultura y comenzar en el negocio de la tienda porque sus ingresos eran mínimos y no daba abasto para cubrir todas las necesidades del hogar y sacar a sus hijos adelante.

El dinero del préstamo lo necesita para comprar, golosinas, galletas, pan, sopas, papel higiénico, entre otros artículos para la tienda.- De esta manera espera surtir más su negocio, ya que por ser época de fin de año, las 
ventas incrementan.

El sueño de Marcelino, es que su negocio crezca y que en un futuro sean sus hijos quienes lo administren y que les quedo como herencia.
texts.en:
Marcelino is 70 years old and studied through the second grade. He has been married for more than 40 years. He has two children who are married.

Marcelino worked in agriculture, but now he is a merchant. He currently has a small store in his house, which he has managed for more than 20 years. Marcelino chose to leave agriculture and start this business because his earnings were minimal and not enough to cover all of his household needs and help his children move forward.

He needs the money from this loan to buy snack foods, cookies, bread, soups, toilet paper, and other products for his store. This will provide more inventory for his business since his sales increase at the end of the year.

Marcelino’s dream is to grow his business so that his children can manage it in the future since he plans to leave it as an inheritance.

loans.use: to buy snack foods, cookies, bread, soups, toilet paper, and other products for his store.

loans.name: 23 Bắc Thọ Ngư Lộc Group

texts.en:
Hồng operates a store selling cake, sweets, sugar and milk. She has been involved in this business for four years, and is requesting a loan to purchase more cake, sweets, sugar and milk to resell.

Hồng is 45 years old and she is married with five children. She is the group leader of the 23 Bắc Thọ Ngư Lộc solidarity group, which consists of seven members. 

This is Hồng's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Hồng hopes to build a new house, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more cake, sweet, sugar, and milk to resell.

loans.name: Jose Alfonso

texts.es:
El señor Jose desde muy joven se dedica a las funciones del campo tales como agricultura y cría de animales, actividades que le enseño su padre para que saliera adelante en su vida.
Hoy en día su actividad principal es la agricultura y la ganadería, tiene como objetivo mejorar su capital comprando algunos lotes de ganado que le permitan abastecerse y generar mejores ingresos, y esta es la razón por la cual solicita un préstamo.
Es padre responsable y amoroso con sus hijos, vive en una finca con ellos y su esposa quien ha sido su más grande compañía.
Sueña con poder otorgarles a sus hijos una educación de calidad para que más adelante se puedan defender solos y sean independientes.
Todos los días asiste su negocio y procura por hacer las cosas muy bien y sabe que con la ayuda de la Corporación Interactuar podrá llegar muy lejos.
texts.en: Jose has worked since he was very young in agriculture and raising animals, which are jobs that his father taught him so that he could get ahead in life. His main activities now are agriculture and livestock. His goal is to increase his capital by buying several lots of cattle, which will allow him to earn more income, which is the reason that he is requesting the loan. He is a responsible and loving father to his children. He lives on a farm with them and with his wife, who has been his greatest companion. He dreams of being able to provide his children with a good quality of education, so that later they can take care of themselves and be independent. He works at his business every day, and tries to do his best. He knows that with the help of the Interactuar corporation he will be able to go far.

loans.use: to buy several lots of cattle

loans.name: Jitahidi Msakuzi Group

texts.en:
Rose, who is in her mid 20s, is single with one child who is still small.  She has been running a retail shop for two years now.  She works from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Rose's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase the retail shop inventory and has paid back all her loans successfully. She is happy with the loan.  She used the profit to save in her bank account and to repay the loan dues.  She dreams of becoming  an international businesswoman.

Rose will share this loan with her loan group, Jitahidi Msakuzi, which consists of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy soda, juice and water for the retail shop.

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.es:
La socia Cornelia se dedica al negocio de venta de comida, la socia realiza platos como pollipapas es un plato a base de pollo y papas, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar papas y pollo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member Cornelia earns a living selling food. She makes dishes like pollipapas, a dish made from chicken and potatoes. She's an entrepreneurial woman and wants to get ahead through this business. Her dream is to have a restaurant.

The member is seeking a loan to buy products to cook potatoes and chicken with. She is happy for the loan and promises to comply with her payment quotas.

loans.use: to buy products to cook potatoes and chicken.

loans.name: 12 Minh Đức Minh Lộc Group

texts.en:
Tươi works in agriculture raising poultry. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years, and is requesting a loan to purchase more baby chicks to raise and sell in the future.

Tươi is 38 years old and she is married with two children. She is the group leader of the 12 Minh Đức Minh Lộc solidarity group, which consists of five members. 

This is Tươi first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. The main hardship that Tươi faces in her business is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Tươi hopes for her children to do well in school, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more baby chicks to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Wilberto Aristides

texts.es: Wilberto de 41 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo, el se dedica desde hace 8 años a la crianza de ganado y al cultivo de miz, Wilberto esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de 4 novillos para continuar con la crianza de ganado y poder tener mejores ingresos y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Wilberto is 41 years old and lives in his own house with his son. He has worked for 8 years raising cattle and growing corn. He is requesting a loan to buy 4 steers to raise, so that he can earn more income and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy 4 steers.

loans.name: Nhóm 08 - Thôn 6 - Đông Thịnh Group

texts.en:
Biên works in agriculture, farming poultry. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years, and is requesting a loan to purchase more baby chicks to raise and sell in the future.

Biên is 58 years old and she is married with two children. She is the leader of a four member group, the Nhóm 08 - Thôn 6 - Đông Thịnh solidarity group. 

This is Biên's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Biên hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase more baby chicks to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Nhóm 17 - Thôn 9 - Đông Thịnh Group

texts.en:
Thu works in agriculture, raising fish. She has been involved in this business for seven years, and is requesting a loan to purchase baby fish to raise and sell in the future.

Thu is 35 years old and she is married with two children. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 17 - Thôn 9 - Đông Thịnh solidarity group, which consists of four members. 

In 2012, Thu joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Thu faces in her business is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Thu hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase baby fish to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Lan is 54 years old and married with two children. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns a living working in a local company. Lan earns income through running a food stall to sell noodles with meat. 

She started her business 19 years ago. She intends to take a loan to gradually expand her business by buying good-quality food to sell to her customers. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy good-quality food to sell from her stall

loans.name: Mai

texts.en: Mai is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her store

loans.name: 020206220003 Đại Long - Hoằng Thanh Group

texts.en:
Luật works in agriculture, raising livestock. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years, and is requesting a loan to purchase more baby livestock to raise and sell in future.

Luật is 50 years old and she is married with five children. She is the group leader of the 020206220003 Đại long - Hoằng Thanh solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, which is a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, Luật joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. In the future, Luật hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase more baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Bombani Group

texts.en:
Maria, who is in her early 30s, is married with three kids who are still in school.  She has been running a general store for one year now.  She works from 8 am to 8 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Maria's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will use this loan to increase her general store inventory.  She dreams of owning a wholesale food business.  

Maria will share this loan with her loan group "Bombani", which consists of five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase her genral store inventory.

loans.name: Juana Antonia

texts.es: Juana tiene 50 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida. Juana es una mujer muy trabajadora y junto a su compañero de vida quien es pescador mantienen la economía del hogar. Juana desea invertir en algunas mejoras de su vivienda, ella desea repellar las paredes de su vivienda y construir una pila para reguardar el agua. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de arena, cemento, ladrillo, etc. para proceder a la mejora lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Juana is 50 years old and resides in her own home along with her life companion. She is a hardworking woman who partners with her husband, who works as a fisherman, in order to maintain the household finances.

Juana wants to invest in a few home improvements. She wants to whitewash the walls of her home and build a basin for storing water. Therefore, she is requesting this loan FUSAI so that she can invest in the purchase of sand, cement, bricks, and other supplies. This will allow her to proceed with these improvements as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, bricks, and other supplies in order to whitewash the walls of her home and build a basin for storing water.

loans.name: Chi

texts.en: Chi would like to take a further loan to buy good quality food and many kinds of soft drinks to sell from her stall. Chi's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her to increase the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy good quality food and many kinds of soft drinks to stock her stall

loans.name: Day

texts.en:
Day, 57, is married and has four children: two sons and two daughters. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn an income running a food stall in front of their house. 

She started this business three years ago. She sells rice soup and noodles to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying good quality food and beverages to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy good quality food and beverages to sell

loans.name: Oanh

texts.en:
Oanh is 37 years old and married with three children. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a worker for a post office in a city. She earns income through running an agency that sells lottery tickets.

She started her business one year ago. She intends to take a loan to gradually expand her business by investing more money in buying and selling lottery tickets

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To invest more money in buying and selling lottery tickets

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en:
Hanh is a 42-year-old divorced woman. She has one child. Hanh lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. For two years, she has operated a food stall to sell meals to people in their community.

Hanh would like a loan to purchase new furniture and repair her food cart. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan, she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase new furniture and repair her food cart

loans.name: Maravillas De La Paz Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MARAVILLAS DE LA PAZ” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Marlene es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de artesanías, tienda de barrio, costura de mantas, venta de leche.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Marlene es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una asesora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de servicio gastronómico; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años, primero cono diversión y pasa tiempo, posteriormente vio que este podría ser un buen negocio decide emprenderlo con el apoyo de su suegra.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de harina por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Maravillas de La Paz" (Marvels from La Paz) will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the focal center of Collpani. This group is composed of nine members and is led by a board of directors, of which Marlene is President. The businesses of the communal bank members are varied, among them you will find: sale of artesian products, neighborhood store, blanket production, and milk sales.

The loan they will take out will benefit small entrepreneurs, and Marlene is one of them. She says that she has been working with Pro Mujer for two years, entering by invitation of one of the loan officers of the institution who went to visit her in her home. Today, Marlene has a food serve business. She tells that she launched this business a number of years ago, at first as a fun way to pass the time, and then she saw that this could be a good business and decided to pursue it with the support of her mother-in-law.

The loan she will now take out is to increase her capital (to purchase flour in bulk) which she will acquire through the wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz. Then she will prepare her products and sell them from her business space. This form of work enables her to generate resources to support her family economically, since she is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Marlene responds that she likes the trainings offered by the institution.

loans.use: to purchase flour in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy miscellaneous products like cosmetics, clothes, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy soap

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is 26 years old and he lives with his parents. He is a business engineer and he sells hardware items. He does that from his house and he also goes door to door. Richard goes to La Paz and El Alto. Richard goes to hardware stores and with independent people. He needs a loan to increase his hardware products. Richard will appreciate your help a lot.

loans.use: to increase his hardware products

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy is a 38-year-old married woman. She lives with her three children and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. For over two years, she has operated a soft drinks shop in front of her house.

Thuy would like a loan to purchase a greater range and quantity of soft drinks to stock her store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers.

Thuy also hopes that through her loan, she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase a greater range and quantity of soft drinks to stock her store

loans.name: Vicenta Lorena

texts.es: Vicenta tiene 21 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos de 5 años y 4 años de edad. vicenta se dedica a prestación de servicios domésticos desde hace cucho tiempo y es así como junto a su compañero de vida mantienen la economía de  su hogar. Vicenta solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de puertas y ventanas para su vivienda y así poder brindar mayor seguridad a su familia.
texts.en:
Vicenta is 21 years old and resides in her own home along with her life companion and their two children, ages 5 and 4. She has been providing housekeeping services for quite some time. Vicenta and her life partner coordinate with one another to maintain the household finances.

She is requesting this loan from FUSAI so that she can invest in the purchase of doors and windows for her home. This will provide greater security for her family.

loans.use: to buy doors and windows for her home.

loans.name: Norma Yanira

texts.es: Norma de 28 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y su hijo de 4 años de edad. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que se gana la vida con su negocio de venta de ropas actividad que realiza, de forma ambulante en los cantones y mercados cércanos, la cual le ha  permitido sostener a su familia. Norma desea surtir su mercadería ya que sabe que en esta temporada navideña las ventas mejoran, por lo que ella desea tener una gran variedad y cantidad de productos para ofrecer a su clientela y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: faldas, blusas, pantalones, camisas, camisetas, etc.
texts.en:
Norma is 28 years old. She lives in her own home along with her husband and her four-year-old son. She is a hardworking woman who earns her living through her business selling clothing. She conducts these sales by foot around the cantons and markets nearby. This has enabled her to sustain her family.

Norma wants to stock her merchandise since she knows that during the Christmas season sales get better. For this reason she wants to have a large variety and quantity of products to offer to her customers. For this reason she requests a loan from FUSAI to invest in: skirts, blouses, pants, shirts, tank tops, etc.

loans.use: to purchase skirts, blouses, pants, shirts and tank tops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Edwin Gerardo

texts.es: Edwin tiene 27 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos de cuatro y un año de edad. Él se dedica a la pesca artesanal desde hace mucho tiempo. Dicho oficio es el que le permite llevar el sustento a su hogar. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones de vida ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea instalar el servicio de energía eléctrica y repellar las paredes de su vivienda. Con el monto solicitado comprará: cemento, arena y pagará la mano obra para la instalación de la energía eléctrica.
texts.en:
Edwin is 27 years old and resides in his own home along with his wife and their two children, ages 4 and 1. He has been working as a small-scale fisherman for quite some time. Edwin says that his work allows him to sustain his household.

Wanting to improve his living conditions, Edwin decided to request this loan from FUSAI because he wants to install electricity and whitewash the walls of his house. The amount he requested will be used to buy cement, sand, and also pay for labor so that electricity can be installed.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and also pay for labor in order for electricity to be installed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install electricity in his home.

loans.name: Tam

texts.en: Tam is requesting a new loan to buy a motorcycle to travel to the market and deliver food. This purchase will help her to more efficiently run her business and satisfy her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her food stall, increasing sales, and improving her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to travel to the market and deliver food

loans.name: Ut

texts.en: Ut is requesting a new loan to repair and upgrade her computer system to satisfy her customers. Ut's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing her sales. She also hopes that through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to repair and upgrade her computer system to satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy lengths of pagnes (colorful West-African fabric)

loans.name: Golibjon

texts.ru:
Голибчон  родился 1986 году в семье работника. Он  женат и имеет троих  детей. Он с детства очень трудолюбивый. В дехканском хозяйстве «Холйигитбобо» имеет 2.5 гектар земли, из них  2,0 гектара винограда и 0,5 гектара для выращивания  других селхозкултур.  В земледелии ему помогает жена и его сыновья. Он также занимается животноводством, которое ему приносит не малый доход. Голибчон имеет шесть голов крупно рогатого  скота и пять голов овец. В свободное время он подрабатывает работая столяром – плотником. 
 Голибчон  с МДО Арванд с  2012 года. Он хочет получить кредит для земледелия. Он хочет подготовится к весеннему сезону,обработать земли и купить семена. Он заранее благодарит за поддержку.
texts.en: Golibjon was born in 1986 into a worker's family. He is married and has three children. He has been very hardworking since his childhood. Golibjon has 2.5 hectares of land in the "Holyigitbobo" dekhan farm, on 2.0 of which he grows grapes and other agricultural crops on 0.5 hectares. His wife and sons help him with the farming business. He is also involved in animal husbandry, which yields him a good income. Golibjon has six heads of cattle and five sheep. He also works part-time as a carpenter. Golibjon has been partnering with MDO Arvand since 2012. He wants to obtain a loan for farming to prepare for the spring season, treat the land and buy seeds. He is grateful in advance for the support.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for the spring season

loans.name: Angelica De Jesus

texts.es:
Angelica, a sus 59 años de edad, es una mujer carismática y servicial que se dedica a trabajar en su propio negocio, una tienda de abarrotes que inició por la necesidad de generar ingresos para sacar adelante a su familia (Padre, Ver Foto)
A pesar de las adversidades, ella tuvo la fortaleza y la determinación para levantarse y seguir adelante y, gracias a ello lleva unos meses de trayectoria en esta actividad.
Su propósito en la vida es seguir progresando y por ello desea fortalecer su negocio acreditándolo con la compra de surtido de productos como abarrotes, granos, frituras, bebidas gaseosas y en general productos básicos de la canasta familiar, de esta forma podrá ofrecer a sus clientes una mejor calidad y servicio, logrando aumentar notablemente sus ventas y los ingresos que recibe de sus ventas.
Angelica manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo su negocio con la ayuda de Interactuar y en un futuro desea convertirlo en un supermercado, en el que los clientes puedan encontrar todos los artículos que necesiten. 

Apoyando a este crédito estarás contribuyendo con el emprendimiento de las mujeres Colombianas!
texts.en:
Angelica is 59 years old. She is a charismatic and service-oriented woman who works in her own business, a grocery store which she launched because she needed to generate income to take care of her family (see her father, in the photo). Despite adversities, Angelica had the fortitude and determination to rise up and get ahead; and thanks to that she has been in this business for a few months. 

Her purpose in life is to continue progressing, and for this reason she wants to strengthen her business by investing in it through the purchase of a stock of products such as groceries, grains, frying ingredients, soda drinks, and other general basic products found in family pantries. In this way she will be able to offer better quality and service to her customers, which will enable her to notably increase her sales and the income she receives from her sales. 

Angelica says that her greatest ambition is to continue growing her business with the help of Interactuar, and in the future she desires to convert it into a super market in which her customers can find all the items they need. By supporting this loan you will be contributing to the entrepreneurship of Colombian women!

loans.use: to purchase basic groceries.

loans.name: La Bendicion De Dios 4 Group

texts.en:
Gregoria is one of the members in the group, La Bendicion de Dios 4 (God's Blessing). Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santo Domingo. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her two children. Her most difficult challenge has been to raise her children and to give them a great education.

Gregoria is excited to be taking her third loan with Kiva's field partner, Esperanza International Dominican Republic, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. Gregoria runs a business selling shoes for kids, women and men, and this loan will be invested totally in her business. She runs her business from her house and walks around nearby in her neighborhood. With her business profit she is providing what her family need and is able to save for future investment. Her dream is to have a successful business. 

She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: To buy shoes

loans.name: Esquipulita Group

texts.en:
The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Esquipulita” is made up of seven women from the rural community of Santa Lucia La Reforma, located in Southwestern Guatemala.  All of the women are enthusiastic, hardworking and very determined. Antonia is one of the members of the Trust Bank who is 46 years of age and has four children. One of her children is in school. 

Antonia was never able to attend school but has had her own business since she was a child. She is a role model for her friends in the Trust Bank who see by her example that it is possible to transform poverty into opportunities. Antonia has several businesses. She makes baskets with ribbons that one of her children sells. She has a “tortilleria” in a nearby town, where tortillas are made three times each day. With the help of one of her daughters and two other women, the business is flourishing and sales have increased to the point where Antonia is considering opening another one. She is requesting a loan to purchase more material for baskets, and supplies including corn, lime and gas for the “tortilleria”.

The women of the Trust Bank “Esquipulita” are grateful for the “Micro-credit Plus” Program (loans + education) that Friendship Bridge provides them. They acquire knowledge about a variety of subjects. Each month, a Loan Officer from the organization shares relevant information with the ladies in their own language about women’s health and women’s rights as well as leadership and self-esteem. They have also learned about budgeting, accounting, pricing, marketing and customer service. These are just a few examples of what the ladies are learning.

The women are most appreciative to Kiva investors for funding their loans and believing in their ability to improve their lives and succeed. They are determined to reach their goals and dreams.   

A report on their progress will be given in the very near future. Thank you, Kiva investors!

loans.use: to purchase more material for baskets, and supplies including corn, lime and gas for the “tortilleria”.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy firewood

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy various items

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
For the last seven years, Beatrice has been selling sweet potatoes and she earns a monthly income of 15,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). She is a single mother of two children aged six and three years old.

She has applied for this second loan of 30,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the loan amount to buy more stock of sweet potatoes to sell.

Beatrice will use the anticipated profits to provide for her family's basic needs. She hopes to grow her business and give her children the best education in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sweet potatoes to sell

loans.name: Emina

texts.ru:
Эмина опытная продавщица с города Конибодом. Ей 49 лет. Она на центральном рынке города имеет торговую точку, где занимается продажей конфет и сладостей. Свой бизнес она начинала 10 лет назад вместе с мужем. Муж до сих пор помогает ей в торговле. Это у них главный источник дохода. Эмина имеет взрослого сына и дочь. Сын в настоящее время находится на заработках в России, а дочь замужем и живет со своей семьей отдельно. 
Целью кредита является увеличение товарооборота. Эмина хочет закупить партию конфет и сладостей для перепродажи их в канун Нового года. Таким образом она сможет увеличить доходность от продажи и расширить свой бизнес. Поддержите их.
texts.en: Emina is an experienced salesperson from the town of Konibodom. She is 49 years old. She has a retail outlet at the town's central market, where she sells candy and sweets. She started her business with her husband 10 years ago. Her husband still helps her with the sales. This is their sole source of income. Emina has an adult son and daughter. Her son currently works in Russia, and daughter is married and lives with family separately. The goal of this loan is increasing goods turnover. Emina wants to buy an inventory of candy and sweets for resale prior to the New Year holiday. This is how she will increase her profitability from sales and expand her business. Please support them.

loans.use: to buy candy and sweets for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy fruit

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en:
Fernando is a small dairy farmer who used to spend a significant portion of his revenues on LP gas and chemical fertilizers. Since his biodigester was installed, he has been able to eliminate these expensive and unsustainable supplies and replace them with the biogas and organic fertilizer he produces himself from his cows' manure. 

In addition to giving him milk to sell, his animals' waste is now also turned into a precious resource, which allows Fernando's family to cook and heat water using free and renewable energy instead of fossil fuels. The manure no longer emits greenhouse gases, nor does it contaminate underground water sources and produce bad smells. Furthermore, the bacteria inside the biodigester also treat the manure and transform it into a nutrient-rich fertilizer, which Fernando can apply on his fields to nourish the soils and improve his corn's yield in a natural way. Therefore Fernando will save money while protecting the environment, and will be able to run his farm in a more cost-effective way, which will allow him to invest in its future expansion.

This loan represents 20% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to purchase a 10 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Priscila

texts.en:
Priscila sells cereals in Kapsabet town and has been running this business for 10 years. She is 34 years old, married and together with her spouse they have been blessed with 4 children. 

She will use this loan to buy more stock of cereals, such as maize, to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business and also repay the loan. 

This is her 7th loan term from VisionFund Kenya and she repaid her previous loans successfully. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and be successful.

loans.use: To buy more cereals to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a 10 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester for his dairy farm

loans.name: Maria Fabiola

texts.es:
Fabiola, tiene 32 años, el esposo tiene 38 años, tiene 4 hijos viven en casa propia en el sector de la Esperanza que pertenece a la parroquia de San Roque de la ciudad de Antonio Ante de la Provincia de Imbabura, por el sector donde ellos viven hay producción agrícola y de artesanías como las que ella elabora las camisas Otavaleñas artesanías que son comerciables las cuales las vende dentro y fuera de la provincia son artesanías que la mayoría de indígenas se ponen como una prenda tradicional y cultura y son bien comerciales en el mercado de Imbabura.
Fabiola, necesita el crédito para la compra de una máquina de coser  recta y recubridora  para aumentar la producción y mejorar los diseños de las prendas camisas Otavaleñas  para que sean más llamativas y que se vendan más rápido, con la compra que va realizan va mejorar bastante el taller que ella tiene y así seguir con el mismo ritmo de producción y poder incrementar más sus ventas también seguir ayudando siempre a su marido en los gastos del hogar y en la educación de sus hijos.

Agradece a Fundación Alternativa por el apoyo que les ha brindado para seguir mejorando la calidad de vida y seguir creciendo junto a su negocio.
texts.en:
Fabiola is 32 years old and her husband is 38 years old. The couple has four children and the family lives in a house that they own in the Esperanza sector of the San Roque province, Antonio Ante city, in the Imbabura province. The Esperanza sector has a lot of farming production and handicrafts, including Otavaleña shirts that Fabiola makes. These products can be sold within and without the province and are items worn by many indigenous people as a piece of traditional clothing from their culture. The product also sells well at the Imbabura market.

Fabiola needs this loan in order to buy a sewing machine and overlock sewing machine to increase production and improve the designs of her Otavaleña shirts. They will then be more appealing and sell quicker. By buying more sewing machines, Fabiola will be able to make significant improvements to her workshop and she will be able to continue at the same production rate and increase her sales. Fabiola also wants to keep on helping her husband with household costs and paying for their children's education.

Fabiola is grateful to Fundación Alternativa for the support that they have provided to continue improving her quality of life and growing as her business expands.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and overlock sewing machine to increase sales and thus help her husband with household costs.

loans.name: Filonila

texts.es:
Filonila de 41 años de edad estudió hasta 2nd grado de educación básica, es casada y tiene 5 hijos, el mayor de 22 años de edad vive es independiente y vive aparte, los otros cuatro viven con ella y están estudiando, su esposo trabaja como jornalero y solo él con sus hijos viven con ella.

Filonila es ama de casa, y trabaja lavando y planchando ropa ajena, decidió dedicarse a esto porque no tenía otra forma de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la familia. Camina cerca de un kilómetro para llegar al lugar donde realiza su trabajo. Solicita el préstamo para comprar 300 varas de tusa, 20 cuartones de madera, 8 vigas y 4 libras de clavos para reparar el techo de su casa. Filonila tiene pensado construir un lugar adecuado para la cocina.
texts.en:
Filonila is 41 years old and she studied until the second grade of basic education in El Salvador. She is married and has five children. The oldest is 22 years old and has left home. The other four live with her and they attend school. Her husband is a labourer and only he and the children live with her. 

Filonila is a housewife, and she works washing and ironing other people's clothes. She decided to do this as she didn't have any other way of helping her husband with the household expenses. She walks for close to a kilometre in order to get to the place where she does her work. 

She is asking for a loan in order to buy 300 maize husk poles, 20 wooden planks, 8 rafters and 4 pounds of nails to repair the roof of her house. Filonila has in mind to build an area suitable for a kitchen.

loans.use: to buy materials necessary to repair the roof of her house.

loans.name: Blanca Azucena

texts.es:
Blanca de 28 años de edad está estudiando un técnico en enfermería, es soltera no tiene hijos y actualmente vive con su madre y tres hermanos, nadie depende de ella. Blanca recibe remesas del exterior, pero también se dedica a cuidar animales, aprendió desde muy pequeña con su padre que le enseño a ordeñar el ganado obteniendo así producto que vende y forma parte de sus ingresos. Los animales están a 1,500 mts de su casa y para llegar se va caminando, en esta actividad le apoya su madre y sus hermanos.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar una vaca lechera  para aumentar la producción en su hato, con lo que espera tener mejores ingresos para la familia. Sueña con terminar su carrera y trabajar, para manejar correctamente sus animales y sean más productivos.
texts.en:
Blanca is 28 years old and studying to be a nurse. She is single and has no children. Blanca currently lives with her mother and three siblings; she has no dependents. Blanca receives payments from relatives living abroad but she also works looking after animals. She learned this trade from a young age from her father. She learned to milk the cows to obtain a product to sell and from which to earn an income. Blanca's animals are kept 1500 metres from her home; she arrives there on foot and receives support from her mother and siblings.
