The Flor de Kantutitas comunal bank will begin its fifth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Adela regional center.  It is comprised of eight members and led by a board of directors.  María Luisa is the president.  The businesses that the members of the communal bank carry out are varied and include a neighborhood store, weaving blankets, selling sporting goods, and selling juices.

The loan that they will take out will benefit small business people where María Luisa is a member.  She states that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for three years.  She joined by invitation from a friend who is a client of the institution.

She currently has a business of making sports clothing.  She indicates that she undertook this business several years ago.  Her husband motivated her to do so because he knew this business, and he taught her how to make the clothes.  In time, she decided to undertake an independent business.

The loan that she will now take out is to increase capital (to buy fabric wholesale) that she will get from the wholesale sellers in the city of La Paz.  She will later sell her goods at her stand.  This way of working allows her to generate resources to help her family financially.  She is in a common-law marriage and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the group loans and the savings that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy fabric wholesale.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia works hard to support her family. Virginia is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Virginia requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

Virginia has been in this business for 18 years now.

Virginia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora works hard to support her family. Aurora is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Aurora requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like meat, fish, noodles, vegetables, spices, etc., for her business.

Aurora has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Aurora would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like meat, fish, noodles, vegetables, spices, etc., for her business

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel es un hombre con gran empuje y emprendimiento, desde hace un tiempo se determino a encontrar una actividad que le generar buenos ingresos y que le permitiera ser independiente, es así como desde hace 3 meses inicio con un negocio de licorera en el municipio de San Jerónimo.
Es un negocio bastante popular en el sector y se ha convertido en punto de encuentro para muchas personas.
Con tan poco tiempo en el mercado ya tiene cierto nivel de reconocimiento gracias a la buena gestión de Miguel.
El solicita un préstamo para realizar la compra de surtido de bebidas, licores y frituras para aumentar sus ventas.
Trabaja solo y desea generar empleos.
texts.en:
Miguel is a persistent and entrepreneurial man. Some time ago, he decided to look for an activity that could give him a good income and allowed him to be independent. This is how, three months ago, he decided to open a liquor store in the municipality of San Jerónimo.

His business has become very popular with locals, and a meeting place for many people. Despite being so new, it has gained a good reputation thanks to Miguel’s management.

Miguel is requesting a loan to buy different types of alcoholic beverages and fried snacks to increase his sales. He works alone, but would like to create job opportunities.

loans.use: to buy different types of alcoholic beverages and fried snacks to sell.

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en:
Perveen is a 45-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market and dealing with customers by sitting at the shop. Over time, they have become popular in their community for providing good quality products, and they make enough to meet the expenses of their five children. 

Currently, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy packs of salts, biscuits, oil, sugar, rice and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at their store to get a boost in their earnings.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits, oil, sugar, rice and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store to get a boost in her earnings.

loans.name: Fayyaz

texts.en:
Fayyaz is 45 years old and a hardworking mother of three children. She is striving hard to meet their demands, including food, clothing, and health. She started her business of stitching to meet the expenses of her children. She is well familiar with the stitching techniques. She enjoys a great client list and has gained a lot of appreciation and popularity in her community. 

She requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy stock of threads of different colors, buttons, needles, laces, etc., so she will be able to meet customers' demand on time. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work.

loans.use: to buy stock of threads of different colors, buttons, needles, laces, etc., to meet customers' demand on time.

loans.name: Luz Amparo

texts.es:
Luz desde muy temprana edad aprendió el oficio de confección de ropa gracias a su mamá que toda su vida fue confeccionista y fue así como poco a poco Luz empezó a entender y aplicar estos conocimientos.
Tiene dos hijos que son su más grande adoración.
Es una mujer emprendedora, amorosa y siempre dispuesta a atender a sus clientes de la mejor manera.
Se siente muy agradecida con todo lo que ha podido construir hasta ahora con la ayuda de la Corporación Interactuar.
Ella pide un apoyo económico para comprar una plancha industrial e insumos de confección como tela, hilos y agujas.
Tiene muchas esperanzas en su negocio y conserva la ilusión de tener un taller mucho más grande en el que pueda ofrecer empleo y aumentar sus clientes.
texts.en:
Luz, at a very young age, learned to work of sewing clothes, thanks to her mother who her whole life was a seamstress and it was in this way that, little by little, Luz began to understand and apply this knowledge.  

She has two children who are her biggest devotion. 

She is an enterprising and loving woman, and is always ready to serve her customers in the best way.

She is very grateful for all that she has been able to build up to now with the help of Corporación Interactuar. 

She asks for a loan to purchase an industrial iron and sewing supplies such as fabric, thread and needles.

She has a lot of hope in her business and has a vision of having a much larger shop where she can provide jobs and expand her customer base.

loans.use: to purchase an industrial iron and sewing supplies such as fabric, thread and needles.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan se desempeña exitosamente en su negocio de cerrajería y soldadura de metal, siendo una persona muy reconocida en el barrio por su buen trabajo y servicio. 
Ya que ha laborado 6 años con los conocimientos que adquirió por medio de su trabajo en distintos talleres, ha tenido la oportunidad de mantener su trabajo y ha intentado mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia. 
Por esta razón quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de lotes de metal y hierro.
Con estos elementos podrá continuar prestando su servicio ya que ésta es su materia prima.

Actualmente vive en unión libre con su pareja a la cual siempre trata de ayudar económicamente para que pueda mejorar su vida. 

Su mayor sueño es poder tener un gran taller con varios empleados y poco a poco podrá lograr su objetivo. 

Ayuda a un joven emprendedor con ganas de salir adelante con un préstamo!
texts.en:
Juan works successfully in his locksmith and metal welding business, being a person very recognized in the neighborhood for his good work and service. 

Since he has worked for 6 years with the knowledge that he acquired though his work in different shops, he has had the opportunity to maintain his work and has tried to improve his family's living conditions. 

For this reason, he wants to ask for a loan to purchase loads of metal and iron. 

With these elements, he will be able to continue offering his services since this is his raw material. 

Currently, he lives in a common-law-marriage with his partner who he tries to help economically so that she can improve her life.

His greatest dream is to be able to have a big shop with several employees and, little by little, he will be able to achieve his objective.  

Help this young entrepreneur with desire to get ahead with a loan!

loans.use: to purchase loads of metal and iron.

loans.name: Khursheed

texts.en:
Khursheed is a 56-year-old married woman. She has been involved in the business of milk sales with the help of her husband for many years. Their business is good enough to lead them a decent life, and they have improved their business to meet the day-to-day expenses of their four children.

Khursheed wants to increase her sales; therefore, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase one more cow. This will increase their sales, which ultimately help in generating more earnings. Khursheed is hopeful that this loan will bring positive changes to their business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow to increase her sales.

loans.name: Las Violetas Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “Las Violetas” está constituida por 05 socios dinamicos y responsables. María de 52 años de edad es casada con 06 hijos independientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir. Hace mas de 03 años que viene desempeñandose en dicho negocio donde ha podido educar sus hijos. Tiene planeado poner su propio local de venta ya que hasta el momento lo realiza de manera ambulatoriamente. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de pantalones, polos, camisas y medias. El grupo “Las Violetas” está agradecido con el crédito brindado, pues hace posible su progreso. María es la primera del lado izquierdo y viste polo rosado.
texts.en: The group “Las Violetas” is made up of 5 dynamic and responsible members. María is 52 years old, married and has 6 independent children. She works selling clothing. For more than 3 years she has been carrying out this business so she can educate her children. She has plans to open her own sales stand but up to now she has been selling itinerately. She is requesting the loan to buy pants, t-shirts, shirts and socks. The “Las Violetas” group is grateful for the loan offered as it makes their progress possible. María is the first on the left wearing the pink shirt.

loans.use: to buy pants, t- shirts, shirts and socks.

loans.name: Brenda Maria

texts.es: Brenda Maria mayor de edad madre soltera con un hijo menor de edad originaria de Chinandega ubicada en el occidente del país, zona que se caracteriza por ser productivamente comercial, es una microempresaria que se dedica a la compra venta de mercadería en general y cosméticos como: perfumes, labiales, rubor, sombra de ojos, lápiz delineador, marbelline, pantalones jeans, faldas, blusas, short, camisas, ropa de cama, ropa de niño jugos de toallas,de forma ambulante el cual inicia su jornada diaria desde muy temprano a entregar sus productos y conseguir nuevos clientes, sus compras y ventas son al contado inicia este negocio con fondos propios debido a la necesidad de trabajar y el de mejorar los ingresos en su hogar al verse sola y madre soltera tuvo el compromiso de salir adelante con su hijo, Brenda es una mujer que se caracteriza por ser emprendedora, trabajadora y responsable con todos sus compromisos adquiridos, ha venido poco a poco mejorando su negocio,no es primer crédito con león 2000 en el cual ha demostrado su responsabilidad de pago en tiempo y forma, uno de sueños es poder ver a su pequeño hijo convertido en todo un profesional poder tener su propia casa, El objetivo de este crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de mercadería en general como:ropa nueva, cosméticos, prendas de oro entre otros mas, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Brenda María is an older single mother with one minor child.  She's from Chinandega, located in the western part of the country, an area known for commercial productivity.

She's a micro-entrepreneur who earns a living selling general merchandise and cosmetics, including perfume, lipstick, rouge, eye shadow, eyeliner, Maybelline products, jeans, skirts, blouses, shorts, shirts, pajamas, children's clothing, and towel sets.  She sells as a street vendor and starts her work day very early so she can deliver her products and acquire more customers.  Her purchases and sales are in cash.

She started her business with her own funds because she needed to work and improve her household income.  She was alone and a single mother, so she had to commit to getting ahead with her son.

Brenda is known for being an enterprising, hardworking, and responsible woman with all her commitments.  She has been improving her business little by little.  This is not her first loan with Leon 2000, and she has been responsible with her payments.

The goal of this loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business for buying and selling general merchandise, including new clothing, cosmetics, and gold jewelry so she can earn more income in the near future.

One of Brenda's dreams is to see her young child become a professional and have his own home.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise, clothing, and cosmetics such as make-up and facial cream

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Avelina is 53 years old, and one child is still in school.

Avelina has a juice-making business in the Philippines. Avelina requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients and materials for her business.

Avelina has been in this business for 20 years. Avelina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients and materials for her business

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine earns a living by producing ice candy. She sells its to locals in the community. She is 28 years old and a married woman with five children. She comes from Talibon, Bohol. Her oldest child is 10 and the youngest is 2. Her husband's occupation is driver.

She has requested  a loan to buy  additional supplies like milk, sugar, various flavorings like mango, chocolate, pineapple or buko (young coconut meat), ice candy wrappers and many other. These ingredients will be used in making ice candy and  they will also produce a variety of flavors that will suit the customers' taste.

In this way, Christine could earn more and start to settle her obligations. She will start to set aside savings for the education of her children.

Christine dreams to expand her current business to make it productive and hopefully this would alleviate her present situation and lead to sustainable livelihood in the future.

loans.use: to buy  additional supplies like milk, sugar, various flavorings like mango, chocolate, pineapple or buko (young coconut meat), ice candy wrappers and many other items

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 32 years old, married, and has four children. Her husband earns a living by means of fishing. She engages in a food vending business. She cooks home meals such as fish escabeche, stewed vegetables, and pork and meat recipes and sells to the people in the community where she lives. She sells fresh fish to earn additional income.  

Jessica requested a loan, which she will use to buy additional supplies for her food vending business, such as seasonings, meat, vegetables, and spices. These ingredients will be used in producing a variety of meals that will attract more consumers to purchase and provide higher earnings. With the added income, Jessica will be able to provide her family with nutritious diets. She is determined to successfully manage her business  to support the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as seasonings, meat, vegetables, and spices

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en: Melanie is a 23-year-old married woman from Concepcion, Iloilo. She earns a living through her hog-raising business. Melanie is asking for a loan to buy piglets to raise and animal feed. A loan will help Melanie in improving her hog-raising business as well as her income. In the future, Melanie hopes of making her business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the future schooling of her child.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise and animal feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase farm inputs such as insecticides, fertilizers, and seedlings to use in her farming business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Elmeda

texts.en:
Elmeda, 58 years old, lives in Katipunan, Zamboanga Del Norte, with her husband and four children. Her husband is a construction worker. Unable to sustain the needs of the family with only her husband’s income, she has found ways to attain income through snack and food vending. It began with selling a small amount of viands and snacks to their neighbors. She joined Paglaum Cooperative, which helped her in the capitalization of her sari-sari (small grocery) store in January of 2004. She became a MIGS (member in good standing) member, which is why she has received loans several times already. 

Now, she applies for 14,000 PHP to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store. She hopes that her business will continue and someday become a mini-grocery.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her sari-sari (small grocery) store

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine engages in farming. She grows and sells rice. She is a 45-year-old married woman with three children. Two of them are still attending school. She has been farming rice for more than twenty years. Her husband’s occupation is a carpenter.

She is asking for a loan to buy farm supplies such as fertilizers. These will help Josephine's farming livelihood improve. Because of these, her yield would be at high volume, and this could lead to more quantity of rice to be sold. She would now start to manage her income and start to pay her dues.

She dreams that her existing sources of income will be more productive, and she is determined to properly manage her resources, going to sustainable livelihood in the near future.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as fertilizers.

loans.name: Lonie

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Lonie works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell frozen food business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from prepared food vending.  Lonie is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock of frozen foods like bacon, hot dogs, etc. to sell.

Lonie has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of frozen foods like bacon, hot dogs, etc. to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase cement, bricks and other construction materials to expand and renovate the house.

loans.name: Lazarus

texts.en:
The role of transport to rural smallholder farmers in Kenya like Lazarus (pictured) is crucial. As in other businesses, transportation is a phase in the production process which is not complete until the commodity is in the hands of the final consumers. 

Lazarus, 27 lives on a small piece of land in Kitale. The region is popular for growing maize as a staple food. Lazarus had been engaged in farming--keeping poultry and dairy cows--for not less than five years, when he saw a big gap and seized the opportunity. The road networks in Kitale have been terrible since time immemorial. The road situation has forced farmers to sell their produce within their environs at a low price because of surplus supply. Roads to the farm can hardly be accessed by motor vehicles. 

Lazarus purchased an ideal Indian motorcycle with low fuel consumption, low maintenance costs and a great deal of flexibility. With this machine, he was able to transport his milk and eggs to a distant market with fair prices, as well as offer transportation services to pedestrians along the way when he was returning. He saw a bigger potential in helping other farmers transport their produce and sell it at a better market price. 

Lazarus is seeking a loan to purchase more motorcycles. This will enable him to fill the demand for his services as well as offer employment to others in his community. With your loan, Lazarus will realize his vision of offering transformational transport solutions that seek to improve agricultural productivity, enhance quality of life for farmers, create a market for agricultural produce, facilitate interaction among geographical and economic regions, and open up new areas for economic focus.

loans.use: To purchase more motorcycles for transportation of farm produce to market

loans.name: Diana Jacinta

texts.es:
Sin mucho capital, Diana montó su taller de confección con el ánimo de generar ingresos con los cuales pueda sostener los gastos de su hogar donde convive con sus 2 hijos y su esposo. 
La actividad la aprendió realizando algunos cursos y esto le ha permitido realizar trabajos que se caracterizan por su buena calidad y su puntualidad en la entrega. 
Con sus trabajos, Diana ha logrado captar un gran número de clientes que le han garantizado muy buenas ventas mensuales, por lo que espera que su negocio siga creciendo y posteriormente pueda generar empleo para las personas más necesitadas. 
Con la finalidad de responder a la demanda sus clientes, Diana busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de una maquina plana industrial.
Diana espera que así su familia pueda gozar de unos mejores ingresos los cuales les permitan tener una mejor calidad de vida y una educación de mejor calidad. 
Además, Diana espera que si su negocio sigue ampliándose a un buen ritmo y que en su taller pueda generar como mínimo un empleo para una persona que lo requiera y no tenga oportunidades laborales.
texts.en:
Without much capital, Diana started her tailor shop intending to generate income to support the household expenses. She lives with her husband and two children.

She learned by taking some courses, and this has allowed to her to produce work that stands out for its good quality and prompt delivery.

She has attracted a great number of clients, which has guaranteed very good monthly sales, and she hopes that her business will continue growing and allow her later to offer employment to others.

Diana is looking for a loan to buy a flatbed sewing machine, so that she can better respond to the demands of her customers. Her family will enjoy better income as a result, improving their quality of life and allowing for better quality education.

Diana hopes, if her shop continues to grow at a good rate, to generate employment for at least one person who may need work and may not have access to other opportunities.

loans.use: to buy a flatbed sewing machine.

loans.name: Jose Leonardo

texts.es:
José  es un señor de 32 años, vive junto a su esposa y sus dos pequeños. Habitan en una humilde casa en la ciudad de Santo Domingo, sector comercial y conocido en el país por ser el puente que une a la sierra y a la costa.
José es un señor muy trabajador, desde hace más de siete años cuenta con su propio negocio, se dedica a la reparación de radios, televisores y plasmas, hace su trabajo también a domicilio. Poco a poco ha salido adelante, ahora es muy conocido en el sector. Gracias a su esfuerzo comenta José él ha podido construir su casa, es pequeña pero viven felices.
Con el crédito adquirido en Fundación Alternativa podrá ampliar su casa, hacer un cuartito más para sus pequeños, está muy agradecido por la oportunidad que le han dado, con ello mejorará su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José is a 32 year old man who lives with his wife and his two small children. They live in a humble house in the city of Santo Domingo, the commercial center and known in the country as being the bridge between the mountains and the coast.

José is a hard-working man. For the last 7 years he has had his own business where he works repairing radios, televisions and plasma TVs. He also goes to people's homes. Little by little he has been getting ahead and now he is well-known in the area.

He comments that thanks to his efforts he has been able to build his own house, which is small but they live there happily. With the loan he has acquired from the Fundación Alternativa he can expand the house, building a room for the children. He is very grateful for the opportunity he has been given. It will improve his quality of living.

loans.use: to build a room for his small children in his house and improve their quality of living.

loans.name: Amparo Del Rocio

texts.es:
Sin mucho capital, Amparo montó su taller de confección con el ánimo de generar ingresos con los cuales pueda sostener los gastos de su hogar donde convive con su hijo. 
La actividad la aprendió realizando algunos cursos y esto le ha permitido realizar trabajos que se caracterizan por su buena calidad y su puntualidad en la entrega. 
Con sus trabajos, Amparo ha logrado captar un gran número de clientes que le han garantizado muy buenas ventas mensuales, por lo que espera que su negocio siga creciendo y posteriormente pueda generar empleo para las personas más necesitadas. 
Con la finalidad de responder a la demanda sus clientes, Amparo busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de una maquina recubridora y surtido de tela.
Amparo espera que así su familia pueda gozar de unos mejores ingresos los cuales les permitan tener una mejor calidad de vida y una educación de mejor calidad. 
Además, Amparo espera que si su negocio sigue ampliándose a un buen ritmo y que en su taller pueda generar como mínimo un empleo para una persona que lo requiera y no tenga oportunidades laborales.
texts.en:
Without a lot of capital, Amparo undertook her sewing shop with the desire to generate income with which she can sustain the household expenses where she lives with her son. 

She learned the work taking some courses and this has allowed her to do work that is characterized by its good quality and punctuality of delivery. 

With her work, Amparo as managed to attract a large number of customers who have guaranteed her very good monthly sales, so she hopes her business continues growing and later she will be able to provide jobs for the people who most need them. 

With the end of responding to her customers' demand, Amparo is seeking a loan to offer her the opportunity of purchasing an overlocking machine and an assortment of fabric.  

Amparo hopes that in this way her family can enjoy a better income, which will allow them to have a better quality of life and a better quality education. 

In addition, Amparo hopes that if her business keeps growing at a good rhythm, she could create at least one job in her shop for a person who needs it and doesn't have job opportunities.

loans.use: to purchase an overlocking machine and an assortment of fabric.

loans.name: Luis Felipe

texts.es:
La venta de frutas y verduras, es la actividad en la cual se desempeña Luis, un hombre con empuje y perseverancia para sacar adelante su propio negocio y a su familia.
Ella se dedica a esta actividad desde hace más de 4 años trabajando desde muy temprano en la mañana todos los días para ofrecer sus alimentos.
Decidió iniciar este proyecto al ver la necesidad de obtener más ingresos para su familia y opto por la venta de frutas y verduras como su fuente de ingresos.

Es un hombre simpático y servicial, siempre dispuesto a atender las inquietudes y deseos de sus clientes.
El pide un auxilio económico con la Corporación Interactuar para comprar una un amplio surtido de verduras y de esta manera abastecerse y vender una mayor cantidad de alimentos.
Su sueño es tener un local en cual pueda vender tranquilo y cómodamente sus alimentos.
Presta y aporta hoy, anímate!
texts.en:
Selling fruits and vegetables is the work that Luis does. He is a man with drive and perseverance to get his business and his family ahead. 

He has worked in this business for the past 4 years, working from very early in the morning every day to offer his food. 

He decided to start this project when he saw the need to get more income for his family, and he chose selling fruits and vegetables as his source of income. 

He is a likable and helpful person, always ready to attend to the concerns and desires of his customers.

He asks Corporación Interactuar for a loan to purchase a wide assortment of vegetables and in this way stock up and sell a larger quantity of food.

His dream is to have a retail space where he can sell his food peacefully and comfortably. 

Loan and support him today, be inspired!

loans.use: to purchase a wide assortment of vegetables to stock his business.

loans.name: Luz Mery

texts.es:
Con una gran fuerza de voluntad y con una actitud positiva se pueden lograr muchas cosas en la vida, esto lo tiene muy claro luz, que a sus 52 años y siendo madre de 4 hijos desea superarse y ser una mujer completamente independiente.

Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa, calzado y accesorios para iniciar con la venta de esta mercancía y así poder mejorar las utilidades con las que vela por el bienestar de su familia.

Es una mujer emprendedora y muy trabajadora y por eso merece uan gran ayuda y colaboración.
texts.en:
With great determination and a positive attitude, one can achieve many things in life. This is clearly the case with Luz. She is 52 years old and the mother of four children, so she wants to excel and become a completely independent woman.

Luz is requesting a loan in order to buy clothes, shoes, and accessories so that she can begin selling this merchandise. This will improve her profits so that she can provide for the welfare of her family. Luz is an enterprising and hardworking woman, so she deserves assistance and cooperation.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, and accessories so that she can start her business.

loans.name: Madre Selva Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MADRE SELVA” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Calixta  es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, ayudante de construcción, venta de ropa para niños, venta de medicamentos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Calixta es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años por iniciativa propia al observar el amplio comercio de este producto decide invertir un poco capital en el mismo. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de cocina, ollas y víveres por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.

En la imagen se puede identificar a una persona por demás, ella esta vestida con una chompa blanca, la misma quiso acompañar al grupo.
texts.en:
The "MADRE SELVA" communal bank group will begin its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de Santiago II. It is made up of eight members and is led by officers of whom Calixta is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal bank carry out are varied and among them are food sales, construction assistant, sales of children's clothing, and medicine sales. 

The loan that they will take out will benefit the small business owners of whom Calixta is one, she says that she joined Pro Mujer a year ago, joining at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. Currently, she has a business selling food. She says that she began this business a number of years ago by her own initiative when she saw the broad sales of this product and decided to invest a bit of capital in it. 

The loan that she is taking out now is to increase her capital (purchase a cooking range, pots, and groceries in bulk) that she will get from the wholesalers in the city of La Paz and later will sell in her stand. This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family economically, since she lives with a partner and has 2 children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the training and the health center that the institution offers. 

In the picture, a person in the back can be seen wearing a white sweater. She wanted to accompany the group.

loans.use: to purchase a cooking range, pots and groceries in bulk.

loans.name: Alveiro De Jesus

texts.es:
Alveiro es un humilde trabajador residente en el municipio de Frontino con una vida colmada de sueños, esperanzas y los mejores deseos para su familia. Es padre de 2 hijos por los cuales siempre ha tenido el valor y responsabilidad de responder para que su vida fuera la mejor.
Hoy en día se gana la vida con la venta de helados, estos alimentos los transporta en una carretilla y los vende de manera ambulante.
De las principales dificultades que debe enfrentar en su trabajo son las fuertes lluvias, los largos desplazamientos y el alto costo de las materias primas.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido de helados al por mayor y una moto para transportarse y asi tener una muy buena venta en esta temporada de fin de año, así podrá tener los ingresos suficientes para continuar con su negocio y sostener a su familia.
texts.en:
Alveiro is a humble hard worker, resident of the municipality of Frontino, with a life full of dreams, hopes and the best desires for his family. He is the father of two children for whom he has always had the value and responsibility of responding so that their life would be the best. the

These days, he earns a living with ice cream sales. He transports these foods on a cart and sells them as a street vendor. 

Of the primary difficulties that he has to face in his work are the heavy rains, the long distances to travel, and the high cost of the raw materials. 

He asks for a loan to purchase an assortment of ice creams in bulk and for a motorcycle to get around and in this way have good sales in this end-of-year season. In this way, he will be able to have the income sufficient to continue with his business and sustain his family.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of ice cream in bulk and a motorcycle.

loans.name: Kyakabuzi Tweyimukye Group

texts.en:
Leonard a member of the Kyakabuzi Tweyimukye Group whose members guarantee each other.  He is 34 years old and has 3 children.  He lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. 

He has a retail shop and also farms, growing food crops like maize, beans and tea. He started these businesses with the hope of getting income to expand his retail business. 

Leonard needs a loan to purchase more stock like cooking oil, washing soap, sugar, salt and rice to sell this festive season when demand is high.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, washing soap. sugar, salt and rice to sell.

loans.name: Angie Paola

texts.es:
Angie en su búsqueda por un futuro prometedor y unas buenas oportunidades para salir adelante, decidió iniciar un negocio que según ella le dará todo eso que siempre ha soñado.

Montara un negocio de tienda de abarrotes en su casa en el municipio de Puerto Boyaca, con el cual planea sostener a su familia compuesta por sus dos hijos y su esposo.

Su principal dificultad es la falta de capital para trabajar.

Para lograr esto necesita la ayuda de un préstamo con la Corporación Interactuar que le permita comprar un enfriador, estanterías, vitrinas y surtido de productos básicos de la canasta familiar como abarrotes, granos, galletas y otros alimentos para abastecer e iniciar su negocio.

Apoya a los sueños emprendedores de una Colombiana con un préstamo hoy!
texts.en:
Angie is in search of a promising future and a few good opportunities to get ahead, so she decided to start a business. According to her, she will give everything she has to fulfill this dream she has always had.

Angie will open a grocery store in her home in the town of Puerto Boyaca. She hopes this business will sustain her family, which consists of her husband and two children. Her main difficulty is the lack of working capital.

In order to achieve her goal, Angie needs the help of a loan from Interactuar so that she can buy a cooler, shelving, display cabinets, and a stock of basic household products such as groceries, grains, cookies, and other foods to fill and start her business.

Support the entrepreneurial dreams of a Colombian woman with a loan today!

loans.use: to buy a cooler, shelving, display cabinets, and a stock of basic household products so that she can open a grocery store.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane has been a hog raiser for three years. She is married and has three children who are still attending school. She is currently raising one sow and two pigs. Generated income from her hog raising is used to meet their daily expenditures, school fees, and maintenance costs for her seven hectares of rice field.

With her continuous increase in expenses, Mary Jane is asking for additional capital in the amount of PHP 5,000 to be used in buying feed, vitamins, and vaccines. She believes that through sustaining her hogs with complete nutrition, she could be able to make her hogs healthier and sell them to traders with a better price.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and vaccines for her hogs

loans.name: Gladys Pilar

texts.es:
En Santo Domingo de los Colorados, ciudad perteneciente a la parte costera del Ecuador, vive la señora Gladys junto a su pequeña hija en una humilde casa de madera muy acogedora.
Desde hace años atrás ella quedó viuda, le afectó mucho pero no podía quedarse así por sus hijos, decidió ir a vivir a finca de unos familiares para empezar de nuevo; poco a poco Gladys fue sembrando plantas de plátano y ahí pudo vender las racimas para sustento del hogar,  así fue creciendo poco a poco, ahora también se dedica a la producción de palma africana y de cacao, no saca mucho producto pero si lo necesario para salir adelante prosperando.
Gladys comenta siempre haber trabajado con una sola institución, pero se deslindó de la misma por la demora en los trámites, conoció a Fundación Alternativa  por referencias del sector; ahora pudo  obtener un crédito, le mismo que o invertirá en dar mantenimiento a las plantas y a resembrar plátano para mejorar su ingresos; se siente muy feliz porque la institución pudo darle la mano, comenta que lo invertirá muy bien para que a un futuro le sigan ayudando.
texts.en:
In Santo Domingo de los Colorados,a city that belongs to the coast of Ecuador, Gladys lives together with her small child in a humble but welcoming house built of wood.

She was left a widow many years ago, which affected her a lot but she couldn't stay like that because of her children. She decided to live on a farm belonging to family members and start anew. Little by little Gladys planted banana trees and thus was able to sell the fruit to sustain her household. So she continued growing little by little.

Now she also is producing African palm and cocoa. She is getting much product but it is necessary in order to get ahead and proper. Gladys comments that she has been working with only one institute but she separated from them because of delays in formalities.

She knows Fundación Alternativa from local references and now she can get a loan which she will invest in providing maintenance for the plants and replanting bananas to increase her profits. She feels happy that the institution can give her a hand up and comments that she will invest it very well so that in the future they will continue to support her.

loans.use: to give maintenance to her plants and banana plants and thus progress and give a big boost to her family.

loans.name: Tam

texts.en: Tam's previous loan enabled him to increase his sales and earn a higher income to support his family. He requested another loan, which he will use to buy steel and equipment for his shop. He hopes that this loan will assist him in increasing the size of his business, attract new customers, and increase sales. He also hopes that he can increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase steel and equipment for his shop.

loans.name: Rexy

texts.en:
Rexy started out as a manicurist and beautician within her local community. Generated income from her home service manicurist business was used to invest in other business which are hog-raising and buying and selling charcoal.

Rexy is 41 years old, married with one child. Her family lives simply in a place where most of their income comes from their farming business. With her determination to keep her hog-raising, beauty salon, and charcoal businesses growing, she is seeking a loan amounting to PHP 7,000. She will utilize this  loan in buying five piglets and feed for her hog-raising business.

loans.use: to buy five piglets and feed for her hog-raising business

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en:
Thirty-three-year-old Juditha operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells various goods ranging from  coffee, cornstarch, bleaching agents, mosquito repellent, diapers, seasonings, and soap to many others. She is  a married woman with six dependents.  Her husband earns a living by being an electrician.

Juditha is asking for a loan to purchase two sacks of rice, chicken feed, and grocery supplies. These would fill her store and could attract more customers. With these, she could now be able to manage her finances and start to pay her dues. She will be able to provide her family with a nutritious diet and build a better shelter to live in.

Juditha would like to expand her business to be progressive, and this could be the start to becoming stable in the future.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of rice, chicken feed, and grocery supplies

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is a 30-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. She is from Concepcion, Iloilo. She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than ten years now. Fishing is their main source of income. She also sells dried fish.

Belinda is asking to take a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, crab traps, and other items. This loan will enable Belinda and her husband to improve their fishing business as well as their income.

In the future, Belinda hopes to make their business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, crab traps, and other items.

loans.name: Celerina

texts.en:
Celerina works hard to support her family. Celerina is married and has a rug making business in the Philippines.

Celerina requested a 26,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more materials for her rug making business. She has been in this business for 11 years now.

Celerina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her rug making business.

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en:
Celestina is 58 years old and married with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Celestina has a general store business in the Philippines. Celestina requested a 21,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock like shampoo, detergent soap, bath soap, eggs, cereals, coffee, etc. to sell. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business. Celestina has been in this business for 16 years. 

In the future, Celestina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like shampoo, detergent soap, bath soap, eggs, cereals, coffee, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.fr: Monsieur Joseph est marié et père de 5 enfants tous étudiants. Enseignant de formation, il excerçe dans un établissement protestant de la place à l'âgé de 53 ans. Il vient solliciter un prêt pour lui faciliter le paiement des frais académiques de ses enfants. Il remercie HEKIMA pour avoir songé à ce produit qui aide et soulage les enseignants et parents à maigre salaire.
texts.en: Joseph is a married 53-year-old father of five. He is a teacher in a Protestant school. He has requested a loan to pay his children's academic costs. He thanks Hekima for having thought up this idea to help teachers and parents with low salaries.

loans.use: to pay his children's academic costs.

loans.name: Tulindane Group

texts.fr: Madame CHIKWANINE est une femme mariée, âgée de 45 ans et mère de 8 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle est membre du groupe TULINDANE où elle joue le rôle de présidente. Elle s’occupe de la vente des habits depuis 1998 suite au premier fonds venu de la poche de son mari. Elle vient de demander un prêt qui devra lui permettre d’acquérir 4 douzaines de jupes, 10 douzaines de blouses et 2 douzaines de tricots. Dans l’avenir, elle compte acheter une parcelle.Elle remercie à cet effet HEKIMA, pour son soutien.
texts.en:
Madame Chikwanine is a married woman, age 45. She has 8 children, all in school. She is a member of the Tulindane group, where she is the president. She has sold clothing since 1998, with her first financing coming from her husband. She just requested a loan to acquire 4 dozen skirts, 10 dozen blouses and 2 dozen sweaters. In the future, she wants to buy a plot of land.
She thanks Hekima for their support.

loans.use: to buy 4 dozen skirts, 10 dozen blouses and 2 dozen sweaters.

loans.name: Evangelista

texts.en:
Evangelista is a married woman with eight children, three of whom are still in school. She is 52 years old and a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Evangelista has a fruit and vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Evangelista requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell to her customers. Evangelista has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future, Evangelista would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mai would like to take a further loan to buy materials to make wedding turbans for brides and grooms to sell from her stall. Mai's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family.

She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers, and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy materials to make wedding turbans for brides and grooms.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy pieces of loincloth and women's tunics.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy blue dye and soap.

loans.name: Aissatou Amadou's Group

texts.fr:
Nouvellement inauguré ce 23 décembre 2014 ce banc villageois est composé de femmes désireux d’améliorer leurs conditions d’existence via des activités génératrices de revenu. Elles vivent dans un même village depuis plusieurs décennies et entretiennent des relations de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles s’activent dans le petit commerce. 

Madame Aissatou Amadou, âgée de 46 ans (assise à la deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite et levant la main droite), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de cinq enfants âgés de 07 à 29 ans. Elle est vendeuse de légumes qu’elle se procure au marché régional par panier ou sac, elle vend aussi  des produits de consommation courant : riz au détail, et condiments.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 03 sacs de riz à 13 500 FCFA, divers condiments.

Elle compte avec activité accroître son chiffre d’affaire et terminer sa maison en finition d’une part et d’autres part aider son mari à prendre en charge la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This newly-inaugurated banc villageois, opened on 23rd December 2014, is made up of women who wish to better their living conditions through their money-generating activities. They have all lived in the same village for many decades and believe in solidarity and mutual aid. They earn a living through small-scale retail activities.

46-year-old Aissatou Amadou, the woman sat second from the left of the middle row with her hand raised, is the group's star borrower. She is a married mother to five children, aged between seven and 29 years old. She sells vegetables which she gets from the regional market by the basket or by the sack. She also sells everyday foodstuffs such as rice and various other condiments.

With this new loan, she plans on purchasing three sacks of rice for 13,500 FCFA, as well as various other condiments. She plans on increasing her business turnover so she can finish building her house and assist her husband in paying for their children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase three sacks of rice for 13,500 FCFA, as well as various other condiments

loans.name: Dutsimbatare Group

texts.fr:
Rémegie fait partie du groupe Dutsimbatare  et  habite à Gitega. C’est un veuf de   65 ans .Il a un enfant de 18 ans.

Il fait le commerce de tomates. 

Il est à son dix-septième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité  de tomates à revendre  pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Rémegie is part of the Dutsimbatare group and lives in Gitega. He is a 65-year-old widower and has an 18-year-old child.
He sells tomatoes.
This is his 16th loan with Turame. With this loan, posted on Kiva, he will increase his capital and buy a large quantity of tomatoes to re-sell in order to make more money.

loans.use: to buy  a large quantity of tomatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Cyprien

texts.en:
Cyprien is 28 years old. He is a married man with two children between four and six years old. Both children attend school. He has farmed for eight years, and he will use the loan from Kiva to buy fertilizers to use to grow maize to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay his employees.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to use to grow maize to sell.

loans.name: Tuhtamat

texts.ru: Тухтамат мужчина 48 лет , женат , отец четверых детей. Тухтамат трудоголик,любящий свою работу.На протяжение вот уже тридцати с лишним лет он занимается скотоводством.На своем участке земли он разводит крупный рогатый скот.Сейчас у него в стаде пять коров. Его младшая дочь,которая живет с ними,доит коров и относит молоко на рынок для продажи.Жена Тухтамата портниха.Она шьёт женские национальные платья на дому.Тухтамату скоро стукнет 60 лет,но он всё так же бодр и силён как в юности.Он планирует закупить корм для скота на зиму,но ему не хватает суммы денег.Поэтому он обратился в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой.Он надеется,что МДО Арванд одобрит его заявку на получение кредита.Заранее благодарит за помощь.
texts.en: Tuhtamat is a 48 year old man. He is married and is a father to four children. Tuhtamat is a hard worker who loves his profession. For the past thirty or so years, he has been practicing cattle breeding. On his plot of land, he raises cattle. Her currently has five cows in his herd. His younger daughter, who lives with him, milks the cows and brings the milk to the market for sale. Tuhtamat's wife is a seamstress. She sews Tajik-style women's dresses out of their home. It won't be too long before Tuhtamat turns 60, but he still is as spry and strong as he was in his younger days. He plans to buy cattle feed for winter, but he does not have enough money. This is why he turned to MDO Arvand for financial support. He hopes that MDO Arvand will approve his loan application. He thanks you in advance for your assistance.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan es un campesino de 41 años de edad, trabajador y humilde, que desde niño aprendió a realizar todas las labores del campo, gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres. 
Esto le ha permitido progresar y, hoy en día desea poseer cultivos de zanahoria y papa, cultivos, actualmente realiza labores de jornalero en diferentes fincas de la región, pues con ello intenta obtener los ingresos con los que vela por el bienestar de su hija.

Con el apoyo del crédito solicitado en la Corporación Interactuar, comprará insumos agrícolas al por mayor como abonos, pesticidas, fertilizantes y otros, con esto podrá tener algunos cultivos.

Juan, con su espíritu emprendedor, su pujanza y tenacidad, quiere seguir luchando para cumplir el sueño de tener una finca propia, en la que pueda cultivar variedad de productos y así mejorar la rentabilidad del negocio, garantizando una estabilidad económica para su familia.
texts.en:
Juan, age 41, lives in the country and is a hardworking and humble man. As a child, he learned everything that is required to work in the fields thanks to the lessons from his parents. This has allowed him to make progress. Today he has his own carrot and potato crops. He also works as a day laborer on different farms in the region with the intent of generating income so that he can provide for the welfare of his daughter.

With the help of a loan that he requested from Interactuar, Juan will be able to buy farming supplies in bulk such as compost, pesticides, fertilizers, and other items so that he can have a few more crops.

With strength, tenacity, and an enterprising spirit, Juan wants to continue pressing forward until he accomplishes his dream of having his own farm where he can cultivate a variety of products. This would improve the profitability of his business, thus guaranteeing financial stability for his family.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies in bulk such as compost, pesticides, fertilizers, and other items.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is married and has two children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is medical.

Everlyne has operated a food selling business, making dumplings and flat bread for sale. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase several mobile phones to sell, which will help him expand his business.

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Nga, 40, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is working in the construction field.

Nga has been running a food stall, selling pork and noodles, in front of her house for 12 years. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying different food to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and sending her children to school.

loans.use: To buy food for selling at her food stall.

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung, 54, is married and has four children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is working for a local company. She earns an income running a business of washing scooters in front of her house. 

She started this business four years ago. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying scooter-lifting equipment for her shop.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy scooter-lifting equipment for her shop.

loans.name: Kahuruko Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photograph is Mary, a member of Kahuruko Women Group, which joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013. The training benefited her, since she has acquired skills on enterprise development and financial management, and has enhanced her business and improved her livelihood.

She is thirty-one years old, a single mother and blessed with one child.
She earns her living by operating a beauty salon and also does vegetable farming to supplement her income. She is borrowing a loan from Kiva to buy more stock of hair gel, shampoo, body lotions, and wigs for her beauty salon.

She hopes her business will thrive; thus, she will be able to bring up her child in a better way. Mary is happy for the financial help.

loans.use: to buy more stock of hair gel, shampoo, body lotions, and wigs for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Beera Agricultural Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photograph is Eunice, a member of Beera Agricultural Self Help Group. The group joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2011 to benefit from trainings, especially on enterprise development and financial management. Eunice is forty-eight years old, married and blessed with two children who attend school.

Eunice does dairy farming as her main economic activity. She is applying for a loan to buy quality dairy feed that will help improve milk yield. She hopes this will enable her to maintain a consistent milk supply, thus meet her customers’s rising demand, and maintain a stable and improved income. She plans to use the anticipated income to cater for family needs.

Eunice is happy for Kiva’s financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy dairy feed to enhance milk yield.

loans.name: Estela

texts.es: Doña Estela tiene una edad de 44 años quien curso su primaria de forma completa. Ella está casada con don Jorge quien al igual que la mayoría de habitantes del sexo masculino en su comunidad se dedican a la agricultura a la siembra de café, maíz, frijol, entre otros rubros que son fuentes de ingresos para las diferentes familias. De su matrimonio y hogar procrearon cuatro hijos los cuales estudian en el instituto educativo de la comunidad. Como fuente principal de ingresos para su familia y el sustento del hogar se dedica a la siembra y cultivo de café el cual es llevado a cabo en compañía de su familia la cual hace desde hace quince años aprendiendo el mismo de sus padres a muy temprana edad. El terreno que en familia trabajan una parte ha sido comprada y otra herencia del papa del esposo. Sus clientes manifiesta ella son muy seguros y confiables ya que este producto es muy popular por su consumo a diario siendo las mejores ventas en los últimos meses y los primeros de cada año. Los desafíos para este rubro son enfermedades como la roya y el hielo (factor clima). En esta ocasión Doña Estela solicita financiamiento el cual invertirá en compra de fertilizantes y abonos para dar a sus cultivos de café su respectiva abonada cuidando de que estas sean contagiadas y deterioradas por lo cual espera ser apoyada. Junto a su esposo se ha propuesto como meta el poder ampliar el negocio mediante la compra de más terreno para generar mayores ingresos, sembrar un nuevo vivero que tienen pendiente y poder comprar un carro.  Como sueño apoyar a sus hijos en todo lo necesario que puedan continuar con sus estudios para que tengan una mejor oportunidad de trabajo y poderles dejar una herencia a cada uno de ellos.
texts.en:
Estela is 44 years old. She completed her Primary schooling. She is married to Jorge who like the majority of males in their community works in agriculture growing coffee, beans and corn amongst other fields which are sources of income for the various families. She has four children from her marriage who all study in the educational institute in their community.

As the main source of income for her family and to support her household she works planting and growing coffee which is produced in company with her family for 15 years. She learned to do this from her parents at a very young age. The land that the family works has been bought in part and the other part an inheritance from her husband's father. Her clients say that she is very safe and dependable as this product is very popular for daily consumption. Sales are best at the end and the beginning of each year. The challenges in this business are infestations like coffee rust and frost (the climate).

At this time Estela is requesting a loan which she will invest in buying fertilizer and manure to apply the proper fertilization of her coffee crops caring for them as they are damaged and contaminated so they need care. Together with her husband she has proposed the goal of expanding their business by buying more land to create greater income, plant a new greenhouse that they have planned and be able to buy a car. Her dream is to support her children with all they need so that they can continue to study so that they have better employment opportunities and be able to leave each one an inheritance.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and pay for labor to assist her coffee crops.

loans.name: Ernest

texts.en:
This is Ernest; he joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2011 to benefit from training in enterprise development and financial management. He is 61 years old,  married and blessed with seven children.

Ernest does dairy and vegetable farming to earn a living. He is borrowing a loan to buy quality animal feed to enhance milk production and manure to improve on crop yield. He looks forward to improved income, thus be in a position to cater to family needs such as food and clothing.

Ernest is grateful to Kiva for the help and support.

loans.use: To buy manure and quality animal feed that will improve on crops and cows' productivity.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: González Comercio Group

texts.es:
Para llegar a la comunidad donde se encuentra el grupo González Comercio, se recorre un camino de terracería entre plantaciones de caña. Desde que los integrantes recibieron su primer préstamo en VisionFund han podido desarrollar su actividad económica:

María Del Socorro - venta de abarrotes	
Lucila - venta de refrescos 
Adan - venta de pollo
Edgar - venta de calzado 

Doña Ma. Del Socorro está casada con el señor Juan, son padres de 4 hijos de los cuales dos fueron patrocinados por World Vision. Doña Soco, como le llaman sus clientes, ha dedicado 8 años de su vida a vender abarrotes en un lugar que adecuó en casa, así no descuida a su familia. Se inclinó por esta actividad en particular a raíz de su propia necesidad y dificultad para comprar productos básicos como pasta, arroz, frijol o aceite ya que debía viajar hasta otra comunidad para adquirirlos. Motivada también por su esposos, invirtieron sus ahorros en abarrotes y poco a poco su mercancía fue aumentando al reinvertir las ganancias, pronto tenía un amplio surtido y hoy en día también vende algunas verduras como chiles, cebolla y jitomate. Recientemente Soco solicitó un préstamo para comprar frijol, arroz, aceite, chile, cebolla, jitomate, galletas, papel higiénico, refrescos y detergente lo que le permitirá continuar con su actividad. "A pesar de que hay tres tiendas más, yo he tenido éxito debido al buen servicio, variedad y precios accesibles que ofrezco a mis clientes". Lo que doña Socorro espera es mantener estable su negocio invirtiendo las ganancias y los préstamos otorgados por VisionFund y quizá establecer un nuevo negocio más adelante.

El grupo agradece la oportunidad de mejorar sus negocios y poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus familias.

*La fotografia fue capturada en la tienda de doña Socorro quien viste blusa color beige.
texts.en:
To get to the community where the González Comercio communal bank is, you have to travel a dirt road through the sugar cane. Since they received their first loan from VisionFund the members have been able to develop their businesses.
María Del Socorro - selling groceries
Lucila - selling soft drinks
Adan - selling chicken
Edgar - sells footwear

María Del Socorro is married to Juan and they have 4 children two of whom are sponsored by World Vision. Soco as her clients call her has dedicated 8 years of her life to selling groceries in an area of the house that they converted so as to not ignore the family.

She opted for this business in particular because of her own needs and the difficulty in buying basic products like pasta, rice, beans and oil as you had to travel to other communities to get them. Motivated also by her husband she invested her savings in groceries and little by little her merchandise grew reinvesting her profits. Soon she ample stock and today she also sells some vegetables like chiles, onion and jitomate.

Recently Soco requested a loan to buy beans, rice, oil, chile, onion, jitomate, toilet paper, biscuits, soft drinks and detergent which will allow her to continue with her business. "in spite of there being 3 other stores I have been successful because of my good service, variety and accessible prices that I offer my clients."

What Socorro wants is to keep her business stable investing the profits and the loans granted by VisionFund and she'd like to establish another business in the future. The group is grateful for the opportunity to improve their businesses and be able to provide a better quality of living to their families. The photograph was taken in Socorro's store. She is wearing a beige colored blouse.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, oil, onions, jitomate, biscuits, toilet paper, soft drinks and detergents.

location.town: La Coraza, Acatlan de Perez Figueroa, Oaxaca

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 37 years old, married to Janet, and blessed with one child who is still young. He has been in the transport business for the last ten years and earns a monthly income of 10,500 Kenyan Shillings (KES).

He has applied for his third loan of 30,000 KES from Vision Fund Kenya and intends to use the loan amount to buy a donkey cart.

James will use the anticipated profits to provide for the family’s basic needs and also to buy another donkey. He hopes to grow his business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a donkey cart.

loans.name: Christine Mae

texts.en:
Christine Mae is a 33-year-old married woman with three children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Christine Mae has a general store business in the Philippines. Christine Mae requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Christine Mae has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Christine Mae would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila works hard to support her family. Cirila is married and has a buy and sell frozen foods business in the Philippines.

Cirila requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more packs of frozen foods to sell to her customers.

Cirila has been in this business for eight years now.

Cirila would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more packs of frozen foods to sell to her customers

loans.name: Kigata Kwesigangana Group

texts.en: Benard has sold produce since 2009 and does farming to earn his income. He lives in Kagadi Uganda and is married with four children. He is hardworking and desires to build a commercial house though he is faced with inadequate capital and seasonal changes hindering his returns. Benard is asking for credit to buy maize, beans and ground nuts for selling. He is a member of Kigata Twesigangane Group where each member guarantees the other to get a loan since they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy maize, beans and ground nuts for selling

loans.name: Kadogo

texts.en:
Kadogo is married and has four grown children. She lives at a own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are for food.

Kadogo operates a food selling business, making dumplings and flat bread for sale. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar for her business.

loans.name: Valeria

texts.es:
Con la ilusión de salir adelante y superarse, Valeria desea montar un negocio de restaurante en un local ubicado al frente de su casa en el municipio de Medellín.

Esta idea surge a partir de la motivación que le dio su hija que la impulsa para montar este negocio y así generar los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Aunque ella siempre ha querido ser independiente, nunca había tenido el valor de arriesgarse a iniciar con un negocio; pero ahora se siente con la fuerza y capacidad para hacerlo.

Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar todos los elementos necesarios para el montaje de su negocio tales como 1 congelador, nevera, 1 carrito de comidas con freidora, insumos e ingredientes para la preparación de comidas.

Con estos elementos podrá iniciar con este proyecto y podrá cumplir así su sueño de ser independiente.

Con el apoyo a este crédito estarás impulsando las ideas emprendedoras de una madre colombiana!
texts.en:
With the hope of succeeding and moving forward, Valeria wants to open a restaurant in a space in front of her house in the city of Medellín.

This idea came about from the motivation she received from her daughter, who convinced her to start this business so that she could generate the necessary income to sustain her household. Although she has always wanted to become independent, Valeria never had the courage to take a risk in order to start a business. Now she has the strength and the ability to do this.

Valeria is requesting a loan so that she can buy all of the necessary equipment to open her business such as a freezer, a refrigerator, a movable food station with a deep fryer, supplies, and ingredients for preparing food. With all of these elements, she will be able to start her project and fulfill her dream of being independent.

By supporting this loan, you can put into action the enterprising ideas of one Colombian mother!

loans.use: to buy a freezer, a refrigerator, a movable food station with a deep fryer, supplies, and ingredients for preparing food.

loans.name: Maria Karen

texts.es:
María Karen es una señora de 21 años, madre soltera, tiene una nena de 4 añitos, juntas viven en Santo Domingo una ciudad muy comercial y productiva, con un clima agradable. Ciudad conocida también porque en este sector habita la etnia Tsachila por ello el nombre de la ciudad. 
María Karen es una señora muy trabajadora, para sacar adelante a su hija se puso un pequeño negocio, ella vende cosméticos hace 4 años, lo realiza recorriendo a su clientela fija, les visita de casa en casa ofreciendo sus productos;  también vende ropa interior para damas, caballeros y niños. Le ha ido muy bien y se ha dado cuenta que no contar con el padre de su hija no ha sido impedimento para salir adelante. María Karen desea incrementar sus ingresos, para ello necesita comprar ropa por la temporada que es muy buena, quiere invertir en jeans, blusas y pijamas para ofrecer a su clientela. María Karen trabaja con Fundación Alternativa hace dos año, se siente muy agradecida porque gracias a los créditos ella ha podido mejorar su calidad de vida. Ahora se le pudo ayudar con un crédito el cual lo invertirá en cosméticos y mercadería, está muy segura que podrá incrementar sus ventas. Agradece mucho a la institución y al proyecto Kiva ya que ha podido progresar en su negocio.
texts.en:
María Karen is a 21 year old single mother. She has a 4 year old daughter and they live together in Santo Domingo, a commercial, productive area with a pleasant climate. The city is also well-known because the Tsachila ethnic group lives there, which is where the name of the city comes from.

María Karen is a very hardworking woman. In order to move her daughter forward, she started a small business. For the past 4 years, she has sold cosmetics. She visits her customer base at their homes and offers her products to them. She also sells undergarments for men, women, and children. It has gone very well for her, and she has learned not to count on her daughter's father, so that has not been an obstacle for her.

María Karen would like to increase her income, so she needs to purchase clothing for this good season. She would like to invest in jeans, blouses, and pajamas to offer to her customers. María Karen has worked with Fundación Alternativa for the past two years. She is very grateful because, thanks to the loans, she has been able to improve her quality of life.

Now she would like the assistance of a loan, which she will use to invest in cosmetics and merchandise. She is very certain that she will be able to increase her sales. She is very grateful to the institution and to Kiva because she has been able to improve her business.

loans.use: to invest in new merchandise and use the extra income to improve her and her daughter's quality of life.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more women's clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Achat des articles divers

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a married woman and has three children whom all attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 15 years she has operated an mpesa (money transfer) business in the community serving to her neighbours and passeby; she mentioned theft as her major challenge.

With the loan of 20,000 she is requesting for she wants to open another mpesa shop. She decided to join Yehu to get financial assistance and boost her business.

loans.use: to open another mpesa shop

loans.name: Señor De Muruhuay Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “Señor De Muruhuay” está constituida por 06 socios comprometidos y solidarios. Emilia tiene 59 años de edad es casada con 03 hijos independientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes. Actualmente ha logrado mejorar su local y le va bien y tiene pensado poner otro puesto de venta. Es por ello que solicitó el crédito para la compra de azucar, frejol, arroz, harina y huevos. El grupo “Señor De Muruhuay” está agradecido con el crédito brindado, pues hace posible su progreso. Emilia se encuentra de pie  es la primera del lado derecho y viste chaleco marrón.
texts.en:
This is the group "Señor De Muruhuay", which consists of six committed and supportive members. Emilia is 59 years old and is married with 3 independent children.  She makes a living selling groceries. Currently, she is doing well. She has managed to improve her business and has plans to open an additional stall.

For this reason she is asking for a loan to purchase sugar, beans, rice, flour, and eggs. The group “Señor De Muruhuay” is grateful for the loan offered, because it makes progress possible.

Emilia is standing on the far right and is wearing a brown vest.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, beans, rice, flour, and eggs.

loans.name: Tsimbatara Group

texts.fr:
Fidès fait partie du groupe  Tsimbatara  et  habite à  Gitega. Elle a 29 ans et est mariée à Bosco, un maçon. Ensemble ils ont 2 enfants âgés de 2 à 3  ans, tous étudient à l’école  maternelle.

Elle fait le commerce de bière depuis  6 ans.

Elle est  à son  cinquième crédit, avec le crédit kiva qu'elle obtient, elle va augmenter son capital, et acheter de la bière  à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Fidès is part of the Tsimbatara group and lives in Gitega. She is 29 and married to Bosco, a mason. Together they have two children ages 2 and 3. They are both in primary school.
Fides has sold beer for 6 years.
This is her fifth loan. With this loan, posted on Kiva, she will increase her capital and buy beer to re-sell in order to make more money.

loans.use: to buy beer.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Madres Laboriosas Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “Madres Laboriosas” conformada por 11 socios comprometidos y entusiastas. Geovanna de 37 años de edad es separada con 02 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de comida como el lomo saltado.  Ha logrado crecer en su negocio gracias al buen servicio que brinda a sus comensales. El deseo de Geovanna es ampliar y acondicionar su local. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de arroz, pescado, papas, y carne de res. La Alcancía Comunal “Madres Laboriosas” agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por el apoyo brindado. Geovanna se encuentra de pie en la parte posterior es la tercera del lado derecho y viste camisa plomo.
texts.en: The group “Madres Laboriosas” is made up of 11 committed and enthusiastic members. Geovanna is 37 years old, separated and has two dependent children. She works selling food like lomo saltado (Peruvian stir-fry). She has managed to create her business thanks to the good service she provides to her customers. Geovanna's wish is to expand and renovate her stall. She is requesting a loan to buy rice, fish, potatoes and beef. The “Madres Laboriosas” communal bank is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the support offered. Geovanna is standing in the back row, the third from the right, wearing a grey shirt.

loans.use: to buy rice, fish, potatoes and beef.

loans.name: Yuranys María
