texts.es: Yuranys es una mujer de 31 años de edad, residente de un barrio ubicado en el municipio de Barranquilla,  ella está dedicada a su negocio de alquiler de lavadoras y miscelánea desde el año 2004, su idea de negocio surgió tras encontrarse desempleada, con el dinero de la liquidación compró cinco lavadoras, poco a poco fue comprando otras lavadoras con la rentabilidad que le generaron las primeras.  En cuanto a su miscelánea ella comercializa útiles escolares, ropa para bebe, golosinas, y demás artículos de este formato de negocio.  En la actualidad estos negocios funcionan en la casa de su mamá y sus principales clientes son los vecinos del sector a quiénes ofrece de sus servicios de 7 a.m. a 7 p.m.  y cancelan de contado, sin embargo ella también ofrece facilidad de pago. Ella está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará tres lavadoras para incrementar la cobertura del negocio con lo que podrá ofrecer mejor servicio y mayores ganancias. Yuranys trabaja muy comprometida para hacer realidad sus metas a futuro de tener una casa propia y tener más inventarios para su almacén y mas lavadoras.
texts.en:
Yuranys is a 31-year-old woman who is a resident of a neighborhood located in the town of Barranquilla. She has been dedicated to her businesses of renting out washing machines and operating a variety store since 2004. This business idea came about when became unemployed. Using the money from her severance pay, Yuranys bought five washing machines. Eventually she bought additional washing machines with the profits she generated from renting out the others. In her variety store, she sells school supplies, baby clothes, snack foods, and other products found in this type of business. She operates these businesses from her mother’s house. Her main customers are neighbors from the area.

Yuranys offers her services from 7:00 A.M. to 7:00 P.M. on a cash basis. However, she also offers payment options. She is applying for a Kiva loan, her first form of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Yuranys will use the money to buy three washing machines so that she can increase the coverage of her business, offer better service, and generate more income. She is very committed to accomplishing her future goals of owning a house, having more inventory for her store, and acquiring more washing machines.

loans.use: to buy three washing machines so that she can offer better service and generate more income.

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es: Gustavo es un señor de 46 años, soltero, tiene dos hijos ya mayores de edad que tienen su propia familia. Él vive en Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas, ciudad que forma parte de la costa, con un clima cálido húmedo. Gustavo hace 14 años tiene una sastrería ubicada en la parte central de la ciudad, aprendió esta profesión estudiando en la noche en un instituto, poco a poco se compró unas máquinas y empezó con su negocio, donde le va muy bien.  Anteriormente también vendía ropa en otra ciudad pero hace unos 10 años le robaron su mercadería asaltando su local  y lo dejó desfinanciado por lo que tuvo que cerrar, pero su sastrería le ayudó a recuperarse poco a poco. Conoció a Fundación Alternativa hace más de tres años porque escuchó por la radio un anuncio, ahora ya son cinco créditos y se siente muy agradecido ya que poco a poco ha podido comprar más máquinas y así se le ha ayudado a mejorar su calidad de vida. Es un cliente fidelizado con la institución porque comenta que es el mejor trato que ha recibido a comparación de otras instituciones. Ahora con este crédito va a comprar telas, hilos, cierres y demás ya que es una buena temporada para la confección de vestidos y trajes.
texts.en:
Gustavo is a 46-year-old man. He has two adult children who have their own families. He lives in Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas, a city on Ecuador's coast with a humid climate. Gustavo has owned a tailor's shop in the central part of the city for the past 14 years. He learned this profession by attending night school. Little by little, he purchased some machines and started his own business, which is going well. Previously, he sold clothing in another city but, 10 years ago, his store was robbed and he was left with little money, so he had to close. His tailor shop has helped him to recuperate what he lost little by litte.

He heard of Fundacion Alternativa more than three years ago when he heard an announcement on the radio. This is his fifth loan and he is very grateful because he has been able to purchase more machines little by little, which has helped him to improve his quality of life. He is loyal to the institution because he says that he has been treated very well compared to the other institutions.

With this loan, he will purchase thread, fabric, clasps, and other things because it is a good season for dress-making and suit-making.

loans.use: to purchase thread, fabric, and clasps in order to continue working toward his goal of owning a small business.

loans.name: Veronica Alexandra

texts.es: Alexandra es una señora de 29 años de edad, esta casada y tiene 3 hijas, la primera de 12 años la segunda de 7 y la menor de 6 años de edad quienes alegremente asisten  a la escuela, el esposo de Alexandra se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería, Alexandra se dedica a atender una tienda donde ofrece desde confites hasta productos de primera necesidad, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de productos de tienda, mientras que de este negocio espera que le siga yendo bien y comprar una casa y poner su tienda ahí para ya no pagar arriendo
texts.en: Alexandra is a 29 year old woman who is married and has 3 children. The oldest is 12, the next is 7 and the youngest is 6 years old. They all happily attend school. Alexandra's husband works in agriculture and raising livestock. Alexandra works taking care of a store where she offers things ranging from pastries to basic items. The loan will be invested in buying products for the store. She hopes that the business continues to do well so she can buy a house and have her store in it so she doesn't have to pay the lease.

loans.use: to buy grocery products.

loans.name: Adama Awa's Group

texts.fr:
Créer le 07 Janvier 1997, ce banc villageois est l’un des plus anciens dans le système. Actuellement une relève est entrain de prendre les activités en main. Les femmes vivent dans le même  quartier. Il existe une bonne connexion entre les membres du groupe. Elles s’activent principalement dans le petit commerce et la transformation de produits locaux.

Madame Adama (debout à droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de  et mère de 08 enfants dont 07 garçons et une fille. Elle s’active dans le commerce de détail de denrée alimentaire qu’elle achète en gros et demi gros au marché central pour la revente dans son quartier où elle tient une table. Elle a une bonne maîtrise de cette activité.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle désire acheter un sac de 25 kg de détergent en poudre, un sachet de savons de 12 morceaux et divers produits de consommation courante pour la revente.

Les bénéfices sont utilisés en majorité pour la prise en charge des frais scolaires de ses enfants et la nourriture et une partie pour renforcer son épargne.
texts.en:
Created on 7th January 1997, this banc villageois is one of the longest-running in the lending scheme. Duties for running these business are currently in the process of changing hands. These women all live in the same district, with good relations existing between group members. They mainly earn livings through small-scale retail and working with local produce.

Adama, the woman standing to the right of the photo with her hand raised, is the group's star borrower. She is a married mother to eight children; seven sons and one daughter. She earns a living through selling foodstuffs which she purchases in bulk from the main market. She then sells her stock from her own stall in the district she lives in. She has a lot of experience in this activity.

With this new loan, she wants to purchase one 25-kg sack of powdered detergent, one 12-pack of soap and various other day-to-day items which she will then resell. The profits will be mostly go towards paying for her children's school fees and their food, with a small part going towards her own personal savings.

loans.use: to purchase one 25-kg sack of powdered detergent, one 12-pack of soap and various other day-to-day items for resale

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
This is Mercy; she joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013 to benefit from training on enterprise development and financial management to improve her enterprise. 

She is 44 years old, married, and blessed with three children who attend school. She does dairy farming and clothes selling as her main economic activities. She is applying for a loan to buy animal feed to help improve cows’ milk production and purchase stock of clothes to help meet  rising customer demand. This will help improve her income thus she will be in a position to cater for family needs.

Mercy  is grateful to Kiva and all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy animal feed to help improve her cows’ milk production and purchase stock of clothes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase beauty materials to attract more customers.

loans.name: Nhóm 1 - Bình Xuyên Group

texts.en: Lien, 39, works in agricultural production and earns a monthly income of approximately VND 740,000 to support a 85-year-old mother and a 20-year-old daughter with an intellectual disability. She has been a member of the local Women's Union since 1999. Her family does not have a sanitary toilet. With this loan, she will build a septic tank latrine to improve the family's living conditions and contribute to the environmental protection. She is pictured first from the left.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine.

loans.name: Nhóm 2 - Bình Xuyên Group

texts.en: Huyen, pictured first from the left, is 54 years old. She worked in agricultural sector with monthly income of about VND 720,000. She is living with a 84-year-old mother and 4 children, of whom none has a stable job. She has been a member of the Women's Union since 1982. Her family does not have a sanitary latrine. With this loan, Huyen will use the fund to build a sanitary latrine which will improve the family's quality of life and contribute to environmental protection.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine.

loans.name: Nhóm 3 - Bình Xuyên Group

texts.en: Hien, pictured first from the left, is a 51-year-old farmer who makes a monthly income of about VND 720,000. She has been a member of the local Women's Union since 1987. She has 2 grown children who haven't had stable jobs and her husband is usually sick for the whole year. Her family is classified as a poor family and cannot afford to have a sanitary latrine. With this loan, Hien will use the fund to build a toilet which will improve the living conditions for the family members by preventing diseases commonly associated with unhygienic toilets.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine.

loans.name: Nhóm 4 - Bình Xuyên Group

texts.en: Mien, pictured third from the right, is 43 years old. She works in agricultural sector and earns approximately VND 760,000. She is a single mom with one child still in school. She has been a member of the local Women's Union since 1991. Due to the lack of funds, her household does not have a sanitary latrine yet. A portion of Group 4 - Binh Xuyen 's loan will help Mien as well as other group members build a septic tank latrine which will improve the family's hygiene and health and contribute to sanitary improvement in her community.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cellphones to sell them.

loans.name: Faaaloalo

texts.en:
Faaaloalo is 58 years old and single with 5 children. She has a small vegetable garden where she grows cabbages and tomatoes that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 3 years.

Faaaloalo needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, seeds, pots, a watering hose, a new wheelbarrow and a spade. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

Faaaloalo will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, seeds, pots, a watering hose, a new wheelbarrow and a spade

loans.name: Lagimaina

texts.en:
Lagimaina is a 33-year-old woman who is married with 5 children. 

Lagimaina runs a small tailoring business in her community, where she has gained 9 years of experience. She has requested a loan in order to buy rolls of material, a new sewing machine, thread, needles, and a pair of scissors. 

Lagimaina plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses and help with her children's cost of education. She joined SPBD in 2005 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy rolls of fabric, a new sewing machine, thread, needles, and a pair of scissors.

loans.name: Balimaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BALIMAYA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 29 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Fana, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de l’habillement et de savon.
Les femmes du groupe BALIMAYA sont à leur dixième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente SITAN FOUNE, deuxième personne de la gauche vers la droite est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de l’habillement. Elle compte acheter des pièces de pagne chez les grossistes à Bamako.
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce au marché à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 45 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The Balimaya group is made up of married women who are on average 29 years old with 3 children. They all live in traditional families in the Fana village, in the Doiila prefecture, Koulikoro region (the second administrative region of Mali).
They know each other because they are related, are neighbours, and are friends.  They have restaurants, or sell clothing or soap.
They are on their tenth group loan.
With the goal of satisfying the large demand of their clients, they have come to Soro Yiriwaso.
Sitan Foune, the second person on the left, is illiterate. She currently sells clothing. She plans to buy loincloth from the wholesalers at Barnako.
She sells in the market to a mixed clientele. She expects to make an average monthly income of 45 000 CFA, which she will reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Sabaly 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  Sabaly 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans, 2 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à Zamblala, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités de maraîchage pour la première fois. 
La spéculation cultivée est  l’échalote  et laitues avec Madellene, arrêtée au milieu sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des Semences, intrants et matériels en vu d’exploiter  sa partielle de 0,25 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koutiala, après la récolte, à une clientèle mixte. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 105 000FCFA en fin de période.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et faire face à ses dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
Group Sabaly 2’s ten members are married women. They are on average 36 years old with two children, and all live in traditional families in Zamblala, a village in the Koutialia area (in Mali’s third administrative region). They collaborate with micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso to grow fruits and vegetables for the first time.

Madellene, sitting in the middle in the photo, has chosen to grow shallots and lettuce. With her loan, she plans to purchase seeds, intrants (e.g. fertilizers), and tools, in order to farm her half-acre lot. After the harvest, production will be sold at the village level and in Koutiala, to a mixed-gender clientele.

She forecasts an average profit of 105,000 XOF by the end of the cycle. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to pay for her daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and agricultural tools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: invest in electric bulbs, fuses, a fuse box,  and electrical wiring for installing electric energy in her house.

loans.name: Assumpta

texts.en:
Assumpta is 47 years old. She is married and together with her spouse they have been blessed with two children of 24 and 15 years respectively. Her spouse provides additional income for the family.

Assumpta is a farmer as well as clothes vendor, a business she has done for the last six years, earning a monthly income of Kshs. 45,000.

Assumpta has requested her 3rd loan with VisionFund Kenya of Kshs. 22,000 which she will use to buy more stock of clothes for resale.

With the anticipated profits, Assumpta will be able to pay school fees for her children as well as repay her loan.

Her hopes and dreams for the future is to provide for her family's needs with future loan support from VisionFund Kenya.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes to sell

loans.name: Jeny De Los Angeles

texts.es: Jeny de los Ángeles, mayor de edad casada con dos hijos menores de edad del municipio de Chinandega, ubicado en el occidente del país, es una microempresaria y administradora de su propio negocio el cual consiste en la compra venta de mercadería en general como: zapatos, pantalones, camisas, faldas, ropa cosméticos,prendas, sobre camas, perfumes entre otros mas, negocio el cual lo realiza de forma ambulante y en su casa de habitación, se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora responsable y con muchos deseos de superación personal, desde muy temprana edad se vio obligada a trabajar para ayudar con los gastos del hogar, sus compras son al contado y la mayor parte de de sus productos los mantiene en cuentas por cobrar a clientes fijos los cuales recupera semanalmente lo invertido, inicia su jornada diaria desde muy temprano dedicándole unas 10 horas diarias, uno de sus sueños es poder crecer mas en su negocio ver a sus hijos terminar sus estudios convertidos en todos unos profesionales, el objetivo de este crédito es para invertir en la compra de mercadería como: pantalones, perfumes, maquillajes, cremas fasciales, shampoo, juegos de sabanas entre otros mas para así lograr cubrir la demanda de clientes que tiene y aprovechar la temporada de fin de año.
texts.en:
Jeny de los Ángeles is married and has two underage children. She lives in Chinandega, a municipality located in the north of the country. She is a micro entrepreneur who runs her own business. She buys and sells different products, such as shoes, pants, shirts, skirts, cosmetics, bed covers, and perfumes. She works as a street vendor, and sometimes at home. She is known to be a responsible worker, and has a strong will to get ahead.

Jeny has had to work since she was very young to help with the home expenses. She pays in cash for her products, sells on credit to her loyal customers and collects the money every week. She starts working very early and works around ten hours every day. One of her dreams is to expand her business and see her children become professionals.

With this loan, she will buy products to sell, such as pants, perfumes, make-up, facial creams, shampoo, and bed sheets sets. She will be able to fulfil her customers’ demands and will take advantage of the end-of-the-year season.

loans.use: to buy products to sell, such as clothes, cosmetics, facial creams, and perfumes.

loans.name: Alipio Gregorio

texts.es:
Alipio vive en Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas ciudad de la región costa, con un clima agradable. Es una ciudad muy comercial la misma que es considerada puerto terrestre que une a la sierra y a la costa. Alipio tiene 74 años, vive en unión libre junto a su esposa Carmen, actualmente viven ellos y una hija en una humilde casa de madera muy acogedora, ya un  poco desgastada por los años pero una casa muy hermosa por el amor de familia que se siente.
Alipio es un señor muy trabajador, él recorre vendiendo medicina natural, incluso es conocido en la zona por su negocio, cuenta con clientela fija. Además Alipio trabaja como jornalero y también suele hacer pozos de agua cuando lo llaman a realizar este tipo de trabajos, Alipio  no le gusta estar de brazos cruzados él siempre trabaja para salir adelante.
Alipio pudo obtener un crédito en la Fundación el mismo que lo invertirá en capital de trabajo, comprará mas medicina natural para seguir incrementando su negocio. Se siente agradecido por el crédito y porque instituciones como estas ayudan a los que más necesitan.
texts.en:
Alipio lives in Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas, which is a coastal city with a pleasant climate. It is a very commercial city and is also considered a land port because it unites the mountains with the coast.

Alipio is 74 years old and is in a common-law marriage with his wife Carmen. They live with a daughter in a humble, welcoming home made of wood. It is a bit worn by the years, but it is a beautiful home because of the love that you can feel. Alipio is a very hardworking man. He sells natural medicines; he is well-known in the area and has a fixed customer base. Alipio also works as a day laborer and also constructs water wells when asked to do this kind of work. Alipio doesn't like to be idle and is always working to move forward.

Alipio was able to obtain a previous loan from Fundacion Alternativa, which he used for working capital. With this loan, he will purchase more natural medicine to continue to improve his business. He is grateful for the loan and also for institutions like this one that help those who need it most.

loans.use: to purchase more medicine and continue to improve his business.

loans.name: Erika Viviana

texts.es: A sus 28 años de  edad Viviana  es una señora casada que tiene  un hijo de 8 años que se dedica a  estudiar,   Viviana y su esposo tiene 10 años su negocio que es una mecánica, comenta que su esposo arregla los autos y que  ella es quien vende los repuestos y demás objetos que se utiliza en los autos, Viviana necesita el crédito para comprar productos de mecánica, para ofrecer mas variedad y mejorar sus ventas para tener buenos ingresos y así cubrir las necesidades de su hijo para que siga siendo buen estudiante y llegue a culminar su estudio.
texts.en:
Viviana is 28 years old, is married, and has an 8-year-old son who is in school. Viviana and her husband have had a mechanic shop for the past 8 years. She tells us that her husband repairs the cars while she sells parts and other items used in cars.

Viviana needs this loan in order to purchase mechanical parts in order to offer a greater variety of products, increase sales, and earn more money. This way, she will be able to pay for the necessary things for her son so that he can continue to be a good student and finish his studies.

loans.use: to purchase mechanical parts.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman with three children all under her care and attend school. She lives at a rental house that  has electricity  but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Halima wants to start a vegetable and fruit selling business. Her major goal is to become a leading fruit vending business in the area to raise her profits.

For that reason with the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, sacks of fruits such as oranges, mangoes, water melons, and pawpaw. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, sacks of fruits such as oranges, mangoes, water melons, and pawpaw

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes for resale

loans.name: Juan David

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre soltero de 24 años de edad que trabaja en una marquetería, su principal ventaja es que este negocio es único en su barrio.
Aprendió del negocio gracias a que laboro en otras empresas similares, pero con la experiencia que ha adquirido no ha podido suplir una necesidad latente y es la falta de una máquina para cortar marcos pues lo hace manual y le lleva mucho tiempo, por lo que retrasa sus entregas más de lo necesario.
Con la ayuda de un crédito quiere comprar la máquina para cortar marcos y su principal ventaja es que optimizara su producción aumentando un 60% su operatividad.
texts.en:
Juan is a single 24-year-old man who works in a frame shop . His main advantage is that this business is the only one in his neighborhood.

He learned the business thanks to having worked in other similar businesses, but the experience he has acquired has not been able to make up for an unfulfilled need, which is the lack of a machine for cutting frames. He does this by hand and it takes a long time, so his deliveries get backed up more than necessary. 

With the help of a loan, he wants to buy the frame-cutting machine. Its main advantage is that it will optimize his production, increasing his efficiency by 60%.

loans.use: to buy a machine to cut frames, optimizing his operation; this was a manual process that took hours

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
Juan, de 46 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado,  no continuo estudiando porque en su cantón no solo había hasta noveno.- Se casó a los 24 años, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene dos hijos, una hija de 17 años de edad que está estudiando bachillerato y el hijo de 11 años de edad, que estudia cuarto grado en la escuela de la comunidad.  

Juan, trabaja como vigilante de seguridad en una empresa de maquinaria pesada, ya tiene cuatro años de ser empleado en  el mismo lugar, la necesidad de tener un ingreso seguro, lo llevo a optar por este trabajo de vigilante.-Hasta el día de hoy, ha logrado desempeñarlo muy bien, sus empleadores lo estiman por sus honestidad y responsabilidad, ya que el trabajo requiere de esos dos fundamentos.

Anteriormente, se dedicaba a la agricultura.- El trabajo le queda a dos km de su casa, su medio de transporte es una bicicleta, los turnos que le toca cubrir son de 24 horas corridas y descansa la misma cantidad de horas. 

El préstamo que está solicitando es para compra mercadería para surtir una pequeña tienda que tiene en su casa, ya que en estos tiempos de fin de año, la demande crece, por lo tanto ha decidido invertir el cincuenta por ciento del total del crédito, lo demás, será utilizado en la compra de electrodomésticos para el hogar.

Sus sueños a futuro son, que sus hijos puedan estudiar y que tengan las oportunidades que el no tuvo.- También, espera que la tienda siga dando buenos resultados y buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Juan is 46 years old. he studied up to Grade 9 and didn't continue to study as in his canton the school only offered up to Grade 9. He got married at 24. His wife is a housewife. he has two children a 17 year daughter who graduated from High school and a 11 year old son who is in Grade 4 in the local school.

Juan works as a security guard in a heavy equipment company. He has been working in the same place for 4 years. The need to have steady income lead him to choose his work as security. Up to now he has been able to perform well. His employers value him for his honesty and responsibility as this work requires these two basics. Previously he worked in agriculture. His work is 2 km from his house and he gets there by bicycle. His shifts are 24 hours straight and then he has the same amount of time off.

The loan that he is requesting is to buy merchandise to stock the small store that he has in his house. This time at the end of the year demand increases, so he has decided to invest 50% of the total loan. The rest he will use buying appliances for his house. His future dreams are for his children to study and have the opportunities he never had. Also he hopes that the store continues to perform well and provide good profit.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for the small store he has in his house.

loans.name: Abdujalil

texts.ru:
Абдучалил мужчина 50 лет , женат , отец троих детей.Он начал работать в возрасте 16 лет ,после окончания 9 классов школы,чтобы помогать родителям.Он был грузчиком ,продавцом семечек,рабочим на стройке,он пас скот на свиной ферме.На накопившуюся сумму денег Абдучалил купил пару голов скота и начал свой собственный бизнес.Сейчас у него 20 гектаров земли и огромное стадо баранов,овец и коров.Он трудится день и ночь,никогда не устает и не болеет.
Абдучалил привык к работе на свежем воздухе и говорит ,что ни за что не променяет это чувство счастья и легкости.Он планирует расширить поголовье своего стада и закупить корм для скота на зиму.Но у него нет полной суммы денег.Поэтому он обратился в МДО Арванд за финансовой помощью.Абдучалил благодарит за доверие и поддержку.
texts.en:
Abdujalil is a 50-year-old man, is married and is a father to three children. He started working at the age of 16 years old after he finished his 9th year of school, in order to help his parents. He has been a truck driver, sunflower seed seller, construction worker, and he took livestock out to pasture at a pig farm. With his saved up money, Abdujalil bought a pair of cows and started his own business. He now has 20 hectares of land and a large herd of rams, sheep and cows. He works hard day and night. He never gets tired and never gets sick.

Abdujalil enjoys working in the fresh air and says that he wouldn't give up this feeling of happiness and freedom for anything. He plans to expand the size of his herd and buy cattle feed for the winter. However, he does not have the entire amount of needed money. This is why he turned to MDO Arvand for financial assistance. Abdujalil thanks you for your trust and support.

loans.use: to buy livestock and cattle feed.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a 30 year old business man and a new father of a 7-month old daughter. He hails from Kitui – a small town – but moved to Nairobi in Kawangware where he has been staying for the last 9 years. Since then, he has done several different casual jobs – as a caretaker, cleaner, shopkeeper and driver – just to make ends meet in the ever-demanding Nairobi life. He is the first born in a family of 3. His parents were small peasant farmers who struggled to see him through high school. The parents could only make enough to sustain him and his siblings and, as a result, he never got the chance to attend college. After his many challenges, he came across various ecofriendly products. He found he had a knack for selling them and his business began to pick up. Shortly thereafter, he landed to EcoZoom as a reseller of stoves and solar lights. Now, he has been able to support his family and even help pay for his younger siblings’ education. 

Upon receipt of Kiva Loan, Paul plans to buy and stock energy saving stoves and solar lights from EcoZoom. The loan will benefit his business to scale more quickly and reduce operational costs of transporting small amounts of stock. At the moment, Paul’s major setback is inadequate funds to keep the business moving forward and stable.  Transport is also a challenge, especially given that he uses public means to transport bulky stoves – transport that can be unreliable and costly for when he has customers in far-flung parts of Nairobi.  

Paul enjoys selling EcoZoom products because he has created full time employment for himself as an independent entrepreneur and relishes the freedom of being his own boss. He has created a chain of connections in the market through word of mouth, exhibitions and open market selling.

Paul’s work has impacted the community on energy-saving products that reduce pollution, are healthy, environmentally friendly and save on household fuel expenses.  

Paul wants to work towards changings lives through preserving the environment, helping to overcome high illiteracy levels in Kenya, and to change lives through the products he sells.

loans.use: To purchase energy saving stoves and solar lights at wholesale price

loans.name: Winie

texts.en:
Winie is a married woman with four children. She is a first time borrower with UGAFODE Micfrofinance Limited (MDI) and a permanent resident of Matuga-Wakiso. She has requested for a loan of UGX 3,000,00 to add stock to her kitchenware business. She is grateful to Kiva lenders through UGAFODE beacuse the loan provided will enable her to add stock to as she prepares for the Christmas festival, thanks to the low interest rates and the long repayment period. 

Winie is taking this loan to boost her kitchenware business. With this she is hopeful she will make more sales with increased stock and hence increase profit. She is hardworking, and she thanks Kiva lenders and UGAFODE for being there for the financial assistance.

loans.use: To add stock to her kitchenware business

loans.name: Janat** Group

texts.en:
This group is called Janat**. It consists of three women who live in Sana'a city, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 105,000 YER from AMB.

Takwa is the leader of the group. She is a 57-year-old married woman and a mother of seven children, and lives with her family in their own house in a poor area. Her house lacks of a lot of furniture, and most of it is very old.

She works as a housewife, and her husband is the sole breadwinner of the family, an employee in a private sector with a small salary. With that salary, he is not able to furnish the house. As a result, Takwa applied for a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB to purchase curtains for some rooms of the house.

Takwa hopes to expand her house more to make it more spacious.

loans.use: to purchase curtains for some rooms of her house.

loans.name: Yorkinoy

texts.ru:
Ёркиной проживающая на районе Шахритус 25 лет. Она замужняя женщина и мать. Ее ребенку 3 года. Ёркиной добрая девушка. Она занимается земледелием. Серьезно она начала заниматься этой работой 3 года назад. На сегодняшний день доход от этой деятельности является очень важным источником дохода. 
  На данный момент все закончили посев урожая и Ёркиной тоже. Ей остается всего лишь обработать посеянный урожай минеральными удобрениями. Но для купли минеральных удобрений у Ёркиной закончились средства. И она вынуждена обратиться за кредитом.
texts.en:
Yorkinoy has lived in the Shahrituz region for 25 years.  She's a married woman and a mother.  Her child is 3 years old.  Yorkinoy is a kind young lady who earns her living working the land.  She started farming in earnest three years ago, and these days, the money it brings in is a crucial source of income.  

At the moment, everyone has finished sowing their fields, including Yorkinoy.  The only thing left for her to do is add mineral fertilizers to the areas she's sown, but she's run out of money to buy mineral fertilizers, so she's forced to take out a loan.

loans.use: buy mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Gulraiz

texts.en: Gulraiz is a 45-year-old married woman. She has successfully been running a school for 14 years. She has worked hard to bring her school to where it is today. With 80 students, and girls making up more than half of her enrollment, Gulraiz has plans to expand. Motivated and hard working, she knows the value of a good education and wants to provide this to the children in her community. She requires a loan of PKR 75,000 in order to buy chairs and desks, and computers for the school's computer lab.

loans.use: to buy chairs and desks, and computers for the school's computer lab.

loans.name: Salima

texts.en: Salima lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed with six children, and takes care of additional family members. Salima is a poultry farmer, and has been in this business for the last twenty years. She works from home seven days a week. Salima gets additional income from rental houses. She has requested a loan of 2,200,000 UGX to buy poultry feed, vaccines, feeding utensils, and chicks. Her major challenges include high costs of poultry feed. Her goal is to build more rental houses. Major monthly expenses include food and utilities. Salima lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water.

loans.use: To buy poultry feeds ,vaccines,feeding utensils and chicks.

loans.name: Pamela's Group

texts.en:
Pamela lives in a home with concrete walls, a concrete floor, and an iron roof in Migera B village in Ndhiwa, Kenya with her family which includes 1 child. The community of Migera B village collects their drinking water from Kanyandabu spring because there is no piped water supply in this part of rural Kenya. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, often making Migera B’s inhabitants sick and unable to work or attend school.

A new chlorine dispenser offers a solution to the burden of sickness caused by unsafe drinking water. The dispenser is installed at the local water source, where users turn a valve to add chlorine to their jerricans and then collect water as usual. The chlorine disinfects the water and provides residual protection from re-contamination. In Migera B, 52 households will benefit from having access to the dispenser and safe water. Pamela has volunteered to be the dispenser promoter, who is responsible for refilling the chlorine and encouraging the rest of the commumunity to treat their water and keep themselves and their families healthy. There are 4 other volunteer promoters from the surrounding community who are part of this group: Washington, Zacheaus, Emily, and Alice. 

Migera B village needs a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining the dispenser. Pamela believes that the dispenser will help to kill germs and thus do away with water-borne diseases. 

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprints will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Pamela's community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To install and maintain chlorine dispensers to provide access to safe drinking water for the community

loans.name: Monica's Group

texts.en:
Monica is 38 years old, has 2 children, and lives in Kanyatenga A village in Ndhiwa, Kenya. Monica works as a business owner for a living. Where Monica lives, her family and her community do not have access to safe drinking water. The community collects their water from Konganya spring. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause water-borne diseases. If Kanyatenga A had a way to treat their water, they could improve the health of their community, keeping children at school and parents at work.

This is why Monica and 3 other promoters called Grace, Elizabeth, and Rael are requesting a loan for a chlorine dispenser on behalf of their community. Monica was elected to represent her community as a volunteer promoter. She is not only representing her community on Kiva, but also volunteers her time to educate the people in Kanyatenga A village on the importance of safe water, and how to use the chlorine dispenser when they come to fetch water at Konganya spring. The loan will be used for the installation of the dispensers and the initial supplies of chlorine. Monica wants to be a promoter because she  believes that the dispenser will  kill bacteria and germs in water making it safe from water-borne diseases.

loans.name: Joshua's Group

texts.en:
Joshua is 60 years old, has 2 children, and lives in Kalamindi North Kaganda village in Ndhiwa, Kenya. Joshua works as a peasant farmer for a living. His community of Kalamindi North Kaganda village does not have access to clean water. The water that is used for drinking and cooking is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases. Joshua is a friendly member of the community, and has been elected promoter by his village to help it members obtain safe drinking water.

As a volunteer promoter, Joshua represents the community on Kiva’s website and educates the community and how protect their families from unsafe drinking water by using a chlorine dispenser. Joshua and 2 other promoters in his community called Eunice and Hezbon, need a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. Joshua wants to be a promoter because he  believes that the dispenser improve their livelihood and will few children will miss school and the community will work hard in their daily activities.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprints will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Joshua’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.name: Ut

texts.en:
Ut is 48 years old and is married with one son. Her husband is a brick layer. She has been running a food stall selling mix of rice paper with ingredients in front of her door for two years. She started this business to cover her expenses. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.

Ut is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater quantity and variety of rice paper and ingredients to sell from her stall. 

She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities and have money to reinvest to her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy rice paper and ingredients for selling.

loans.name: Cirnia

texts.en:
Cirnia is a businesswoman from San Juan, Siquijor. She is 54 years old, a widow, and has expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari (variety) store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family. 

Cirnia is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken out several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. Now she has applied for a loan to restock her store with basic goods and consumable items. 

Cirnia continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic goods and consumable items

loans.name: Lidia Magdalena

texts.es: A sus 52 años de edad Magdalena es separada de su esposo, ella tiene 4 hijos 	quienes ya son casados y viven aparte, Magdalena vive sola y tiene una tienda donde ofrece confites, productos de aseo, de primera necesidad entre otros, el crédito lo necesita para la compra de productos de tienda, para mejorar su negocio y readecuar su tienda y lograr mejores ventas y seguir trabajando  para cubrir sus gastos ya que prácticamente es una señora sola.
texts.en: At 52 years old Magdalena is separated from her husband. She has 4 children who are now married and live on their own. Magdalena lives alone and has a store where she offers candies, cleaning products and basic needs items amongst others. She needs the loan to buy products for her store to improve her business and adapt her store to get better sales and continue to work to cover her expenses as she is practically a woman alone.

loans.use: to buy products for her store.

loans.name: Joshua's Group

texts.en:
Joshua lives in a home with mud walls, a dirt floor, and an iron roof in Nyabinya village in Ndhiwa, Kenya with his family which includes 4 children. The community of Nyabinya village collects their drinking water from Karaya spring  because there is no piped water supply in this part of rural Kenya. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, often making Nyabinya’s inhabitants sick and unable to work or attend school.

A new chlorine dispenser offers a solution to the burden of sickness caused by unsafe drinking water. The dispenser is installed at the local water source, where users turn a valve to add chlorine to their jerricans and then collect water as usual. The chlorine disinfects the water and provides residual protection from re-contamination. In Nyabinya village, 15 households will benefit from having access to the dispenser and safe water. Joshua has volunteered to be the dispenser promoter, who is responsible for refilling the chlorine and encouraging the rest of the community to treat their water and keep themselves and their families healthy. There are 3 other volunteer promoters from the surrounding community who are part of this group loan: Joseph, Prisca, and Mary.

Nyabinya village needs a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining the dispenser. Joshua believes that the dispenser will prevent sicknesses and kill germs.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprints will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Joshua’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To allow the community to treat their water to make it safe to drink using chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Sebastian Marco Antonio

texts.es:
Sebastián vive en una comunidad llamada Chimaltenango, él es casado tiene 36 años de edad,  vive muy feliz con su hermosa familia. 
Sebastián es un hombre que le saca provecho al tiempo,  es muy trabajador, ya que desde pequeño su papá le demostró que para prosperar en la vida hay que entrar de lleno al trabajo.  Sebastián es un hombre que trabaja en el campo agrícola, él siembra arveja china, este producto se comercializa en mercados  nacionales e internacionales, pues para la venta ellos entregan a empresas que se dedican a la transportación de este producto,  después de cuatro años  de experimentar la siembra,  le ha generado ganancias, y es así como él ha podido satisfacer otras necesidades en su familia. 
Pues para este año Sebastián consiguió terreno para sembrar más, pero él no cuenta con capital suficiente para hacerlo, pues en coordinación con su esposa decidieron buscar un préstamo que les servirá  para la compra de insumos y todo lo necesario. Sebastián  para complementar los ingreso,  el también tiene sale a trabajar como jornalero con sus vecinos, esto le permite a Sebastián adquirir nuevos conocimientos en la agricultura. 
Pues el sueño de Sebastián es  cosechar en gran cantidad  para que algún día  él pueda exportar su propio producto sin intermediarios, para la generación de más ganancias.
texts.en:
Sebastián lives in a community called Chimaltenango. He is 36 years old, married and lives very happily with his beautiful family. Sebastián is a man who takes advantage of his time. He is very hard-working as since he was young his father taught him that in order to prosper in life you have to commit yourself completely to your work.

Sebastián is a man who works in agriculture. He plants snow peas which sell in national and international markets. He sells them to companies that work transporting this product. After 4 years of experimenting with this crop, he is creating profits and this is how he can satisfy the needs of his family.

So for this year Sebastián has obtained land to grow more, but he does not have the sufficient capital to do so. So in coordination with his wife he decided to seek a loan which will help them buy the inputs and everything they need. Sebastián to compliment this income also goes out to work as day labor with his neighbors and this allows Sebastián to gain more knowledge about agriculture. Sebastián's dream is to harvest in great quantity so that one day he can export his own product without middlemen in order to generate more profits.

loans.use: to grow snow peas.

loans.name: Sandra Rosa

texts.es:
Sandra es una mujer de 32 años de edad, junto con su esposo quien es agricultor mantiene un humilde hogar que lo terminan de conformar 2 hijos de 4 y 3 años de edad, su ingresos que genera gracias a su negocio de cría y venta de cerdos han ayudado a que sus dos pequeños puedan estudiar y mejorar considerablemente su estilo de vida, por lo menos tener minimanente lo básico.
Ella es una persona del campo la cual recibe poco apoyo y las personas que están dispuestas a darles un préstamo tratan de aprovecharse de ellas, es por eso que agradece la llegada de interactuar que con su ayuda, esta mujer quiere salir adelante  invirtiendo en compra de cerdos y alimento de engorde.
Sandra necesita tu apoyo para sacar su negocio adelante y permitir que sus hijos puedan seguir estudiando y formarse para el futuro.
texts.en:
Sandra is a 32-year-old woman, who upholds a modest home with her husband and their two children, aged four and three.
Their income is provided by their business of raising and selling pigs, which has helped their two little ones receive an education and has considerably improved their life style, so that all their basic needs are met.
Sandra is a rural person and therefore receives very little support. The people who are willing to give her a loan try to take advantage of her and therefore she is very grateful for the help of Interactuar, with which she wants to move ahead and invest in the purchase of pigs and fodder.
Sandra needs your help to make her business thrive and thus continue giving her children an education to prepare them for the future.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed to boost her business at the start of this year

loans.name: Sen

texts.en:
Sen, 53, is married and has four children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn an income running a food stall selling pork and noodles in front of her house. 

Sen started this business seven years ago. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying better quality raw foods and meat to make better dishes to sell.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy raw food and meat to make dishes for selling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy inventory for her general store.
